title: AI FOR FINANCE
description:
Today’s CFOs and finance leaders need more than technical expertise. They’re expected to shape strategic decisions, identify risks and opportunities – and guide their teams through rapid technological change.

AI is already transforming the finance function – and this programme empowers finance executives to navigate the AI era. You’ll learn to assess, implement and leverage AI technology to enhance forecasting, valuation, performance management, cost control and value creation. And you’ll leave with the skills and confidence to integrate AI into your finance strategy, driving transformation across your team.

sections.heading: MODULE 1: DIGITAL MATURITY AND STRATEGY
sections.content:
This programme combines a self-paced online introduction with three intensive days on campus. You’ll start by assessing your finance team’s digital and AI maturity – and then develop a future-focused roadmap. Through hands-on tools, expert insights and peer discussion, you’ll gain the confidence and skills to integrate AI into your finance strategy and operations.

MODULE 1: DIGITAL MATURITY AND STRATEGY
Digital maturity scan: Evaluate if your finance function is ready to adopt AI
AI strategy mapping: Identify the essential components of an AI-focused finance strategy
MODULE 2: FROM DATA TO INTELLIGENCE
Data, governance and automation:
Explore the foundational enablers of AI – from structured data management to cybersecurity
Learn how Robotic Process Automation (RPA) can streamline finance and accounting processes
Analytical AI: Discover how Machine Learning (ML) drives predictive analytics and enhances decision-making
Generative AI: Explore practical cases and exercises that show the potential of GenAI in finance
MODULE 3: LEADING THE TRANSFORMATION
Strategic roadmapping: Create a strategic, actional roadmap and set out clear KPIs to guide your finance team’s AI journey

SUCCESS STORIES
YANNICK VAN OMMEN

Business Controller at BMW

I would recommend this programme highly to anyone looking to advance their career in finance. It provides invaluable insights into the future of finance and equips participants with the skills needed to thrive in a digital world. The knowledge and confidence I gained from this programme have been transformative, and I believe it can have a similar impact on others. Read more about Yannick's story.

MICKEY DINH

Senior Process Architect www.bpostgroup.com

I had the opportunity to participate in the AI for Finance programme, and I gained valuable insights into how to future-proof our Finance department. Our company is striving to become an international player in e-logistics – and so there has never been a better time to optimise our core processes through digitisation, especially when it comes to delivering greater value to our internal and external customers. I highly recommend this programme to anyone who is in pursuit of operational excellence in their finance office.

title: ASSET MANAGEMENT
description: Gain in-depth insight into the front-end business of managing financial assets. In this ten-day programme, you go beyond financial theory to develop a holistic view of how asset management works in practice. You live and learn asset management with practical insights from some of the key players in Belgium’s asset management landscape – including Vlerick faculty and experts from our partner institutions. When you complete the programme you’ll be able to leap confidently into asset management.

ASSET MANAGEMENT

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Kick-off module: Essentials
sections.content:
By the end of this programme, you’ll have excellent inside knowledge of the world of asset management. There are four core modules, each focusing on a specific aspect of asset management activity – as well as an introductory online “essentials” module to prepare you for your on-campus learning journey. 

There’s also an opportunity to participate in two optional, specialised workshops which dive into specific asset management themes. 

You’ll learn from faculty with experience in key roles in the asset management industry. They take an open, interactive approach and encourage you to challenge and ask questions. 

Kick-off module: Essentials  
Industry intro & get to know each other (on campus)
Understand the essentials of (online):
Time value of money
Discount rate
Valuation 
Module 1: Foundations and Risk  
Explore what an asset management company is and how it’s organised, including: 
Active and passive management 
Investment styles 
Balanced portfolio management 
Performance measures 
Compliance, standards, governance and regulation 
Module 2: Legal Aspects and Types of Investors  
Explore risk and the risk management framework 
Learn about monetising risk 
Discover types of investors, including: 
Insurance 
Pension funds 
Private banks 
Module 3: Portfolio management  
Dive into fundamental analysis of equity and fixed income
Discover equity portfolio management
Understand interest rate risk
Explore fixed income portfolio management 
Module 4: Alternative investments  
Explore lifecycle investing
Understand factor investing and smart beta
Discover alternative investments, including: 
Private equity
Real estate
Private debt
Insurance-linked securities

title: CREATING VALUE THROUGH M&A
description: Successful M&A deals can be challenging – and they need time, care and cross-functional expertise. In this four-day programme, you’ll live and learn elements that can make or break a deal – from selecting bona fide prospects that fit your strategy, through to performing proper due diligence, valuing the target, structuring the best deal, and creating value from integration. By the end of the programme, you’ll be able to leap confidently into M&A deals, with the knowledge to make a real impact.

sections.heading: Module 1: Setting the scene
sections.content:
Throughout this four-day programme, you’ll explore aspects of M&A that take place before, during and after acquisition. You’ll consider various strategic rationales, discover steps in the due diligence process, learn integration techniques and listen to seasoned experts and learn from their mistakes and successes. The programme gives you an in-depth A-to-Z perspective of mergers and acquisitions.

Module 1: Setting the scene 
Explore strategy in M&A 
Discover valuation techniques 
Dive into case studies to apply concepts  
Module 2: The process of deal making 
Learn due diligence best practice  
Discover the deal process, step by step 
Understand the decision-making process  
Listen to a testimonial  
Module 3: Structuring M&A transactions and anti-trust issues
Understand underlying financial decisions
Explore empirical evidence of M&A performance
Know how to structure and finance the deal   
Module 4: Post-M&A integration
Dive into a buy-to-build business case
Develop an integration approach using various techniques
Learn to preserve value in the post-acquisition period
Discover how to create value through integration

title: AI FOR FINANCE
description:
Today’s CFOs and finance leaders need more than technical expertise. They’re expected to shape strategic decisions, identify risks and opportunities – and guide their teams through rapid technological change.

AI is already transforming the finance function – and this programme empowers finance executives to navigate the AI era. You’ll learn to assess, implement and leverage AI technology to enhance forecasting, valuation, performance management, cost control and value creation. And you’ll leave with the skills and confidence to integrate AI into your finance strategy, driving transformation across your team.

sections.heading: MODULE 1: DIGITAL MATURITY AND STRATEGY
sections.content:
This programme combines a self-paced online introduction with three intensive days on campus. You’ll start by assessing your finance team’s digital and AI maturity – and then develop a future-focused roadmap. Through hands-on tools, expert insights and peer discussion, you’ll gain the confidence and skills to integrate AI into your finance strategy and operations.

MODULE 1: DIGITAL MATURITY AND STRATEGY
Digital maturity scan: Evaluate if your finance function is ready to adopt AI
AI strategy mapping: Identify the essential components of an AI-focused finance strategy
MODULE 2: FROM DATA TO INTELLIGENCE
Data, governance and automation:
Explore the foundational enablers of AI – from structured data management to cybersecurity
Learn how Robotic Process Automation (RPA) can streamline finance and accounting processes
Analytical AI: Discover how Machine Learning (ML) drives predictive analytics and enhances decision-making
Generative AI: Explore practical cases and exercises that show the potential of GenAI in finance
MODULE 3: LEADING THE TRANSFORMATION
Strategic roadmapping: Create a strategic, actional roadmap and set out clear KPIs to guide your finance team’s AI journey

title: EXCELLENCE IN CORPORATE FINANCE
description:
Having financial approaches that can flex in complex and dynamic times is a must for successful companies. This 12-day programme will transform you into a financial expert who can tackle complex financial issues – and make decisions that have real impact. 

You’ll live and learn essential techniques and tools – so that you can leap with confidence into the complexities facing your business. Your expertise will be highly sought after.

sections.heading: MAXIMISE VALUE WITH EFFECTIVE DECISION-MAKING
sections.content:
EXCELLENCE IN CORPORATE FINANCE
MAXIMISE VALUE WITH EFFECTIVE DECISION-MAKING

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Making financial decisions
sections.content:
Across four core modules, you’ll learn new and enhanced techniques and tools for financial planning, analysis and valuation. You’ll explore theoretical, conceptual and practice-oriented insights. And you’ll leap back into your role with a toolkit of ready-to-use approaches to help you make decisions at local and international levels.

The Excellence in Corporate Finance programme comprises four modules: 

Module 1: Making financial decisions
Learn to interpret financial statements and reports to evaluate a firm’s financial performance and risk 
Know how to assess the cash conversion cycle to develop performance optimisation strategies 
Understand financial planning and capital budgeting concepts
Estimate a firm’s free cash flows
Learn to critically analyse the financial press
Take part in the Working Capital Management Interactive Simulation Game 
Module 2: Financing Strategies –a deeper dive
Discover how to calculate the current WACC of a firm
Learn to design the optimal capital structure of a firm
Understand how smart debt management creates value
Understand the CAPM model
Explore leverage – and know how much to borrow, versus raising equity
Module 3: Accounting for financial decision making 
Develop your financial accounting literacy skills
Grasp the sociology of accounting
Understand the difference between historical cost and fair value accounting
Understand the key principles of accounting for financial instruments
Explore non-GAAP financial measures, and their potential to mislead
Discover AI For the Finance Leader – trends and challenges 
Module 4: Capital budgeting and valuation
Apply advanced company valuation methodologies, including Real Option models
Evaluate, compare, and construct real-life capital budgeting valuation models
Explore managerial flexibility and making decisions under uncertainty
Discover sensitivity analysis, crystal ball and Monte Carlo simulations

The Excellence in Corporate Finance programme comprises four modules: 

Module 1: Making financial decisions
Learn to interpret financial statements and reports to evaluate a firm’s financial performance and risk 
Know how to assess the cash conversion cycle to develop performance optimisation strategies 
Understand financial planning and capital budgeting concepts
Estimate a firm’s free cash flows
Learn to critically analyse the financial press
Take part in the Working Capital Management Interactive Simulation Game 
Module 2: Financing Strategies –a deeper dive
Discover how to calculate the current WACC of a firm
Learn to design the optimal capital structure of a firm
Understand how smart debt management creates value
Understand the CAPM model
Explore leverage – and know how much to borrow, versus raising equity
Module 3: Accounting for financial decision making 
Develop your financial accounting literacy skills
Grasp the sociology of accounting
Understand the difference between historical cost and fair value accounting
Understand the key principles of accounting for financial instruments
Explore non-GAAP financial measures, and their potential to mislead
Discover AI For the Finance Leader – trends and challenges 
Module 4: Capital budgeting and valuation
Apply advanced company valuation methodologies, including Real Option models
Evaluate, compare, and construct real-life capital budgeting valuation models
Explore managerial flexibility and making decisions under uncertainty
Discover sensitivity analysis, crystal ball and Monte Carlo simulations

title: EXECUTIVE MASTER CLASS IN CORPORATE FINANCE
description: The role of finance is becoming increasingly complex and dynamic. Over the course of one year, the 21-day Executive Master Class in Corporate Finance will give you academic knowledge to underpin your financial expertise. You’ll live and learn analysis, solving complex financial issues. You’ll deepen your knowledge by choosing elective subjects. Then you’ll make the leap and apply everything you’ve learned to a challenge or opportunity in your own organisation.

sections.heading: Module 1: Making financial decisions
sections.content:
Build your knowledge and understanding in two broad phases. In the first, you dive deep into the fundamentals of corporate finance. Across four core modules, you learn how to make finance decisions, you develop finance strategies and work on capital budgeting and company valuation.

You get to live everything you learn in a business opportunity or challenge in your own organisation. 

Then in the second phase, you deepen your knowledge by choosing electives that best align with the needs of your company and your role. Choose, for example, the Mergers & Acquisition Path, to enhance your understanding of Creating Value through M&A and Venture Capital and Private Equity. Or follow the Leadership Path and dive deep into Self-Leadership and The People Manager. If you’d rather build your own path, we’d be happy to help you select your electives.

The Executive Master Class in Corporate Finance comprises the following modules:  

Module 1: Making financial decisions
Learn to interpret financial statements and reports to evaluate a firm’s financial performance and risk 
Know how to assess the cash conversion cycle to develop performance optimisation strategies 
Understand financial planning and capital budgeting concepts
Estimate a firm’s free cash flows
Learn to critically analyse the financial press
Take part in the Working Capital Management Interactive Simulation Game
Module 2: Financing Strategies – A deeper dive
Discover how to calculate the current WACC of a firm
Learn to design the optimal capital structure of a firm
Understand how smart debt management creates value
Understand the CAPM model
Explore leverage – and know how much to borrow, versus raising equity
Module 3: Accounting for Financial decision making 
Develop your financial accounting literacy skills
Grasp the sociology of accounting
Understand the difference between historical cost and fair value accounting
Understand the key principles of accounting for financial instruments
Explore non-GAAP financial measures, and their potential to mislead
Discover AI For the Finance Leader – trends and challenges
Module 4: Capital budgeting and valuation
Apply advanced company valuation methodologies, including Real Option models
Evaluate, compare, and construct real-life capital budgeting valuation models
Explore managerial flexibility and making decisions under uncertainty
Discover sensitivity analysis, crystal ball and Monte Carlo simulations

Then in the second phase, you deepen your knowledge by choosing electives that best align with the needs of your company and your role. Choose, for example, the Mergers & Acquisition Path, to enhance your understanding of Creating Value through M&A and Venture Capital and Private Equity. Or follow the Leadership Path and dive deep into Self-Leadership and The People Manager. If you’d rather build your own path, we’d be happy to help you select your electives.

Module 1: Making financial decisions
Learn to interpret financial statements and reports to evaluate a firm’s financial performance and risk 
Know how to assess the cash conversion cycle to develop performance optimisation strategies 
Understand financial planning and capital budgeting concepts
Estimate a firm’s free cash flows
Learn to critically analyse the financial press
Take part in the Working Capital Management Interactive Simulation Game
Module 2: Financing Strategies – A deeper dive
Discover how to calculate the current WACC of a firm
Learn to design the optimal capital structure of a firm
Understand how smart debt management creates value
Understand the CAPM model
Explore leverage – and know how much to borrow, versus raising equity
Module 3: Accounting for Financial decision making 
Develop your financial accounting literacy skills
Grasp the sociology of accounting
Understand the difference between historical cost and fair value accounting
Understand the key principles of accounting for financial instruments
Explore non-GAAP financial measures, and their potential to mislead
Discover AI For the Finance Leader – trends and challenges

Apply advanced company valuation methodologies, including Real Option models

Discover sensitivity analysis, crystal ball and Monte Carlo simulations

PRACTICAL INFO

To apply for this programme, you need to complete four steps:

1. Check your eligibility: Check if you meet the admissions criteria for the programme you want to apply for.

2. Submit your application: Fill out the application form and upload it together with your cv or LinkedIn profile.

3. Take part in an interview: When we receive your application, we’ll get in touch to set up an interview. This will take about an hour and will cover:

Your professional experience and current challenges
Your career ambitions
Why you want to take the programme
Which electives are right for you (if the programme includes electives)

4. Confirm your registration: If you pass the interview, we’ll send you a registration form. You’ll have two weeks to complete and submit the form to confirm your programme place.

The role of finance is becoming increasingly complex and dynamic. Over the course of one year, the 21-day Executive Master Class in Corporate Finance will give you academic knowledge to underpin your financial expertise. DETAILED PROGRAMME

Build your knowledge and understanding in two broad phases. In the first, you dive deep into the fundamentals of corporate finance. Across four core modules, you learn how to make finance decisions, you develop finance strategies and work on capital budgeting and company valuation.

You get to live everything you learn in a business opportunity or challenge in your own organisation. 

Then in the second phase, you deepen your knowledge by choosing electives that best align with the needs of your company and your role. Choose, for example, the Mergers & Acquisition Path, to enhance your understanding of Creating Value through M&A and Venture Capital and Private Equity. Or follow the Leadership Path and dive deep into Self-Leadership and The People Manager. If you’d rather build your own path, we’d be happy to help you select your electives.

The Executive Master Class in Corporate Finance comprises the following modules:  

Module 1: Making financial decisions
Learn to interpret financial statements and reports to evaluate a firm’s financial performance and risk 
Know how to assess the cash conversion cycle to develop performance optimisation strategies 
Understand financial planning and capital budgeting concepts
Estimate a firm’s free cash flows
Learn to critically analyse the financial press
Take part in the Working Capital Management Interactive Simulation Game
Module 2: Financing Strategies – A deeper dive
Discover how to calculate the current WACC of a firm
Learn to design the optimal capital structure of a firm
Understand how smart debt management creates value
Understand the CAPM model
Explore leverage – and know how much to borrow, versus raising equity
Module 3: Accounting for Financial decision making 
Develop your financial accounting literacy skills
Grasp the sociology of accounting
Understand the difference between historical cost and fair value accounting
Understand the key principles of accounting for financial instruments
Explore non-GAAP financial measures, and their potential to mislead
Discover AI For the Finance Leader – trends and challenges
Module 4: Capital budgeting and valuation
Apply advanced company valuation methodologies, including Real Option models
Evaluate, compare, and construct real-life capital budgeting valuation models
Explore managerial flexibility and making decisions under uncertainty
Discover sensitivity analysis, crystal ball and Monte Carlo simulations 
In-company project
Tackle any challenge or opportunity in your own organisation – from acquisition through to LBO, MBO, IPO – and anything in between
Step back and take a strategic view
Use your fellow participants and expert faculty as a sounding board
Create value and ROI

Specialise with 4–6 days from our range of electives

sections.heading: Track I: Understanding Annual Reports
sections.content:
This programme gives you all the basic principles of financial management.  

Track I: Understanding Annual Reports
Module 1: Introducing Annual Reports  
Learn key concepts 
Experience the FAST© simulation 
Discover balance sheets and profit-and-loss accounts 
Understand cash flow 
Module 2: Interpreting Balance Sheets and Profit-and-Loss Accounts 
Explore practice-based case studies 
Discover liquidity, profitability and solvency 
Learn the real meaning of value-add

Do you only wish to take this track? Check ‘Understanding Annual Reports’ for more info.

Track II: Mastering Costs and Budgets 
Module 1: Costing Concepts 
Discover key concepts such as variable and fixed costs, direct and indirect costs, differential and opportunity costs 
Explore various techniques for cost calculations 
Learn about contributions 
Know how to calculate actual, standard and variable costs 
Module 2: From Full Costing to Activity Based Management 
Learn to distinguish relevant from irrelevant costs and yields 
Discover Activity Based Costing (ABC) 
Understand how ABC helps to proactively control cost 
Module 3: Budgeting 
Understand the strategic use of budgets 
Explore strategic variance analysis
Learn how budgets are created 

Do you only wish to take this track? Check ‘Mastering Costs and Budgets’ for more info.

Track III: Grasping Financial Management 
Module 1: Raising financing and working capital management 
Understand the concept and perform calculations of NPV, IRR, DCF etc...  
Develop and implement a financial plan 
Learn to manage working capital 
Module 2: Investment decisions 
Explore front-to-end analysis of the investment process 
Carry out in-depth examinations of various selection methods: Net Present Value (NPV), Internal Rate of Return (IRR), etc 
Learn about feasibility and financing of investments and their related risks 
Assess the profitability of investment projects 

Do you only wish to take this track? Check ‘Grasping Financial Management’ for more info.

title: VENTURE CAPITAL AND PRIVATE EQUITY
description: Innovation and entrepreneurship are powered by venture capital and private equity. But how do these funds work – and how can you make the most of them? This four-day blended programme for investors and financially-savvy entrepreneurs has the answers. You’ll live and learn how VC/PE companies are structured – and how to do deals with them. You’ll become familiar with finance models, capitalisation tables and term sheets. And you’ll gain the skills and tools you need to take the leap into valuing ventures and constructing deals.

sections.heading: Module 1: The Venture Capital and Private Equity Model
sections.content:
DETAILED PROGRAMME

This programme consists of four modules that combine real-life cases, simulations and toolkits to give you an immersive learning experience. Whether listening to an academic lecture, working on a business case analysis or debating investment scenarios in breakout groups, you’ll find the learning experience impactful, practical and thought-provoking.

Module 1: The Venture Capital and Private Equity Model
Dive into private equity and venture capital – and discover how they create value
Explore the business model of private equity and venture capital
Understand the Belgian VC/PE ecosystem
Hear real-life testimonials from an entrepreneur, venture capitalist and private equity manager
Module 2: Valuation of Early-Stage Companies
Learn why traditional corporate finance models don’t work for early-stage companies
Discover the techniques venture capital and private equity investors use
Explore flexible valuation linked to future developments
Module 3: Structuring the Deal
Dive into deal structure funding and debt and equity instruments
Understand common deal features
Explore exit preferences and valuation
Discover how term sheets can reduce risk
Discuss governance and control in a VC-backed company
Module 4: The Buy-out Model
Understand value creation principles in buy-outs
Delve into a debt structuring exercise
Learn to design a Management Buy-Out (MBO) – including financial structure, business optimisation and growth

DETAILED PROGRAMME

This programme consists of four modules that combine real-life cases, simulations and toolkits to give you an immersive learning experience. Whether listening to an academic lecture, working on a business case analysis or debating investment scenarios in breakout groups, you’ll find the learning experience impactful, practical and thought-provoking.

Module 1: The Venture Capital and Private Equity Model
Dive into private equity and venture capital – and discover how they create value
Explore the business model of private equity and venture capital
Understand the Belgian VC/PE ecosystem
Hear real-life testimonials from an entrepreneur, venture capitalist and private equity manager
Module 2: Valuation of Early-Stage Companies
Learn why traditional corporate finance models don’t work for early-stage companies
Discover the techniques venture capital and private equity investors use
Explore flexible valuation linked to future developments
Module 3: Structuring the Deal
Dive into deal structure funding and debt and equity instruments
Understand common deal features
Explore exit preferences and valuation
Discover how term sheets can reduce risk
Discuss governance and control in a VC-backed company
Module 4: The Buy-out Model
Understand value creation principles in buy-outs
Delve into a debt structuring exercise
Learn to design a Management Buy-Out (MBO) – including financial structure, business optimisation and growth

title: CYBER RESILIENCE
description:
You’re leveraging digital technologies to make your offer safe and seamless for your customers. But in doing so, you’re creating an increasingly complex digital ecosystem – which can expose your organisation to serious risk.

In a world where a single incident can have far-reaching consequences, resilience needs to be at the heart of your digital strategy. This programme will help you build the resilience you need to address digital challenges, such as ecosystem fragility, cyber threats, and GenAI-related privacy and ethical concerns.

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Digital context and cyber resilience
sections.content:
This programme takes you through four half-day, live online modules. You’ll develop your knowledge through discussions, case studies, a business simulation and a maturity assessment. You’ll explore changes in the regulatory environment – and discuss the ethical challenges of AI. And you’ll return to your organisation with the essential tools to help your organisation mitigate cyber risk.

Module 1: Digital context and cyber resilience
Discover essential digital resilience principles
Learn how cyber threats are evolving
Explore the impact of regulation like the EU’s AI Act and NIS2
Learn to create a digital vulnerability assessment

After Module 1 you'll take part in a cyber-attack simulation.

Module 2: Cyber strategies and human behaviour
Understand the evolution of resilience across the digital value chain
Learn to develop cyber strategies and make smart investment decisions
Make humans the strongest link in the people-technology relationship
Explore human behavioural challenges

After Module 2 you'll carry out an online Digital Resilience maturity assessment of your own ecosystem.

Module 3: Digital governance in the age of AI
Explore the evolution of AI – and its implications for governance
Discover data lineage principles and practices for decision-making
Know how to strike a balance between innovation and regulation
Learn from a panel of experts on new and envisaged digital regulation
Module 4: Developing cyber agility in the digitised economy
Develop and measure your organisation’s ability to respond to incidents 
Learn how to deal with cyber criminals
Create a mitigation action plan
Explore how threats and mitigation strategies could evolve
Our partner

This programme takes you through four half-day, live online modules. You’ll develop your knowledge through discussions, case studies, a business simulation and a maturity assessment. You’ll explore changes in the regulatory environment – and discuss the ethical challenges of AI. And you’ll return to your organisation with the essential tools to help your organisation mitigate cyber risk.

Module 1: Digital context and cyber resilience
Discover essential digital resilience principles
Learn how cyber threats are evolving
Explore the impact of regulation like the EU’s AI Act and NIS2
Learn to create a digital vulnerability assessment

Module 2: Cyber strategies and human behaviour
Understand the evolution of resilience across the digital value chain
Learn to develop cyber strategies and make smart investment decisions
Make humans the strongest link in the people-technology relationship
Explore human behavioural challenges

After Module 2 you'll carry out an online Digital Resilience maturity assessment of your own ecosystem.

Module 3: Digital governance in the age of AI
Explore the evolution of AI – and its implications for governance
Discover data lineage principles and practices for decision-making
Know how to strike a balance between innovation and regulation
Learn from a panel of experts on new and envisaged digital regulation
Module 4: Developing cyber agility in the digitised economy
Develop and measure your organisation’s ability to respond to incidents 
Learn how to deal with cyber criminals
Create a mitigation action plan
Explore how threats and mitigation strategies could evolve

You’re leveraging digital technologies to make your offer safe and seamless for your customers. But in doing so, you’re creating an increasingly complex digital ecosystem – which can expose your organisation to serious risk.

In a world where a single incident can have far-reaching consequences, resilience needs to be at the heart of your digital strategy. This programme will help you build the resilience you need to address digital challenges, such as ecosystem fragility, cyber threats, and GenAI-related privacy and ethical concerns.

title: DIGITAL STRATEGY AND AI
description: Digital strategy and AI is changing how we do business – and no industry is immune to its power. This programme gives you a comprehensive understanding of how digital technology and artificial intelligence can support your strategic priorities. You’ll live and learn the key principles of digital strategy and AI – and gain the knowledge, skills and insights to take the leap into giving your organisation a sustainable, competitive edge.

description:
What do you need to successfully implement digital transformation in the AI era? On this programme you learn that it’s not about investing in more technology.

Instead, it’s about inspiring people to work in ways that are agile enough to explore and exploit digital opportunities faster than competitors. And how are we going to do this? By developing a new breed of professionals who will guide the way – your organisation’s digital transformation leaders.

Join us to discover how to rewire your whole organisation for agility – and leverage digital transformation for competitive advantage.

SUCCESS STORIES
GREET DE BONDT

Head of Digital Customer Experience D'Ieteren

I strongly believe that embracing digital in a smart way can improve the customer experience and optimise business processes. The programme really confirmed that there is no magic formula for increasing an organisation’s digital maturity. We discovered the variety of tasks, points of view, and number of people that should be involved to get to a good result. The main learning lesson is the necessity of a roadmap for the entire organisation – and this programme provided the tools.




WOUTER VAN ISTERDAEL

Business Unit Director IT Aldi Belgium

It was fascinating to talk to people active in diverse sectors and yet all facing the same issues. The programme also inspired me on a technological level – seeing examples set by the industry pioneers, the technological possibilities, and hearing the guest lecturers who have lived such a transformation first-hand and were eager to share their experiences with the group. Read more on Wouter's Vlerick experience.

TAMARA LIEVENS

Head of IT @MPET

In my current role as Head of IT I have the ability to engage at both the operational and the strategic level. This programme’s mix of theory, energy scan and tips & tools and the shared experiences in implementing digital transformations in practice has given me lots of insights and inspiration. One of the first actions taken in the organisation was to categorise the roadmap according to the four different types of Leading Digital Transformation.

ALEXANDRA KOLODINA

Extended Reality Lead EMEA Medtronic

Working in change management and innovation, I looked for a programme with an end-to-end vision and a ‘people’ aspect beyond ‘digital’. The participants all face similar challenges, and it’s a relief to hear that you’re not alone. Leading Digital Transformation isn’t easy, but it starts with understanding your company’s culture and finding the right leadership styles. Combined with agility and the courage to take risks.

title: MASTERING IT MANAGEMENT
description:
Today’s IT team delivers the platform for all business growth – a holistic ecosystem infrastructure that leverages rapid technological developments, safeguards against threats, creates value and scales delivery.

This programme gives ambitious professionals the integrated skills and confidence to take IT to the next level. It covers everything from strategy and agile value delivery through to data and AI capability building, service performance, sourcing and cyber resilience.

sections.heading: Module 1: Introduction to creating digital value
sections.content:
Over six days, you’ll learn how your IT function can create value while sustaining high levels of security and performance.

Module 1: Introduction to creating digital value

Day 1: Positioning IT to create value

Define what digital transformation means for IT
Explore the role of IT in enterprise value creation
Shift from technical planning to delivering against a strategic narrative

Day 2: Delivering digital value with agile teams

Define what success looks like beyond time, scope and budget
Identify value delivery traps and decision biases
Steer agile teams towards outcomes and measurable benefits

Day 3: Building data and AI capability across an organisation

Explore value-driven data and AI use cases
Assess what it takes to scale data and AI capability
Design governance and architecture for organisation-wide impact

title: TAKE THE LEAD IN AI
description:
When you integrate AI tools into your daily work, you can boost your productivity, enhance creativity and make smarter, data-driven decisions.

This programme is designed to help you unlock the potential of AI in your professional life – from improving efficiency, through to idea generation. Over six modules, you’ll explore real-life cases, develop practical skills – and have opportunities to experiment with AI tools that could transform the way you work.

sections.heading: DISCOVER THE AI TOOLS THAT WILL TRANSFORM YOUR DAILY WORK
sections.content:
TAKE THE LEAD IN AI
DISCOVER THE AI TOOLS THAT WILL TRANSFORM YOUR DAILY WORK

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Enhance your productivity
sections.content:
This programme comprises six modules, each designed to give you tools and strategies to leverage AI in your daily work. Through a blend of self-paced learning and live online sessions, you won’t just learn about AI – you’ll begin to actively apply it.

Module 1: Enhance your productivity
Understand the core concepts and capabilities of AI
Explore how GenAI models generate content
Dive into current AI trends 
Module 2: Master data skills
Use AI to generate, structure, summarise and analyse complex data sets
Create compelling data visualisations to communicate insights
Experiment with cutting-edge AI tools for advanced data analysis
Module 3: Become a creative champion
Use AI tools to generate ideas
Master techniques to refine and evaluate AI-generated concepts
Learn how to integrate AI into brainstorming and other creative processes
Module 4: Make better decisions
Explore how AI can help to assess business options and scenarios
Learn to use AI to make more informed, data-driven decisions
Discuss the ethical implications of using AI in decision making
Module 5: Redefine customer experience
Discover how AI can give customers a faster and more personalised service
Explore how AI can enhance different forms of customer engagement
Module 6: Agentic AI & the future
Analyse the key principles, applications, and limitations of Agentic AI.
Evaluate, select and implement Agentic AI to transform specific workflows.
Apply futures studies techniques to forecast emerging trends and societal impacts of AI.

Module 1: Enhance your productivity
Understand the core concepts and capabilities of AI
Explore how GenAI models generate content
Dive into current AI trends 
Module 2: Master data skills
Use AI to generate, structure, summarise and analyse complex data sets
Create compelling data visualisations to communicate insights
Experiment with cutting-edge AI tools for advanced data analysis
Module 3: Become a creative champion
Use AI tools to generate ideas
Master techniques to refine and evaluate AI-generated concepts
Learn how to integrate AI into brainstorming and other creative processes
Module 4: Make better decisions
Explore how AI can help to assess business options and scenarios
Learn to use AI to make more informed, data-driven decisions
Discuss the ethical implications of using AI in decision making
Module 5: Redefine customer experience
Discover how AI can give customers a faster and more personalised service

Module 6: Agentic AI & the future
Analyse the key principles, applications, and limitations of Agentic AI.
Evaluate, select and implement Agentic AI to transform specific workflows.
Apply futures studies techniques to forecast emerging trends and societal impacts of AI.

title: CHALLENGE BOOTCAMP

key_facts.format: short, intensive, practical and hands-on over 5 days.

description: You have developed a business model that works. Your company is in full operation, but you want to optimize your organisation and develop it further in terms of sales and team. During this practical bootcamp we will look at the identity, unique features and business model of your company. We will reflect on your role as a founder and support you in building an organisation with many opportunities and a solid growth plan.

sections.heading: It’s built around two pillars:
sections.content:
This intensive training brings peace, direction and sharp choices.

It’s built around two pillars:
Pillar 1: Management education 

Preliminary phase

Sharpen your pitching skills to deliver a strong pitch at any time. You will also gain insight into your company's strengths and weaknesses using the Pimento Map tool. 

Module 1: WHAT - Business model optimisation

Focus on the unique characteristics of your business and explore future growth opportunities.
Refine your unique value proposition (USP) to your customers. Evaluate your SME's strengths and weaknesses.
Work on your company's strategy.

Module 2: WHO – Your role alongside a strong team

Reflect on your role in the organisation: are you more likely to be a manager or an entrepreneur?
Define different growth paths for yourself and your team.
Consider who you need in your team and how you will recruit, motivate, and retain those people.
Develop actions for strong and effective team management.

Module 3: HOW – Optimize your business development and financial strategy

Attract more customers and/or select the right ones.
Consider the right sales strategy, with the right balance between sales cost and the expected results.
Get a better understanding of your figures and ask the right questions to your accountant.
Discover new ways to finance your growth.
Pillar 2: Individual counselling path
Application
Interact with our experts at the end of each bootcamp day to apply the management theory and tools into your own business. With the help of concrete reflection questions, you will immediately engage with the content.
Boardroom sessions
Present two of your main challenges, in an intimate setting, to some business coaches and other participants. Get hands-on input, advice, and support.
Final presentation
Pitch your business and action plan in front of a jury of experienced entrepreneurs. They will challenge you and help you on your way to optimization and business growth.

SUCCESS STORIES
RUBEN BAESTAENS

Manager at Are Agency & Simba

One of Vlerick’s Entrepreneurs in Residence recommended the programme – and I’m extremely glad he did. Being able to work alongside like-minded participants is really valuable. You also get to stand back and evaluate your own business and approaches. And the network you build is invaluable.

CHRISTOPHE BOEXSTAENS

Manager at ALU-XTRA

The Challenge Bootcamp gave me the self-confidence and self-awareness to turn my weaknesses into strengths. My communication, leadership, innovation, organisational, sales and overall management skills have all improved. I now dare to say I am an entrepreneur. I even have to hold back a little, because the organisation cannot keep up with me! Thanks to this programme, I know I’ll be able to deliver on my long-term objectives.

CÉLINE CORTVRIENDT

Manager Cortvriendt Tegels NV

The programme gets you out of your comfort zone, which motivated me to do things better. In the past we sometimes used to be behind the curve, but now I plan– I made a list of action points for the coming year, for example. I'm also more aware of how important focus is. The discussions with other participants were really valuable too.

You have developed a business model that works. Your company is in full operation, but you want to optimize your organisation and develop it further in terms of sales and team. During this practical bootcamp we will look at the identity, unique features and business model of your company. We will reflect on your role as a founder and support you in building an organisation with many opportunities and a solid growth plan.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

This intensive training brings peace, direction and sharp choices.

It’s built around two pillars:
Pillar 1: Management education 

Preliminary phase

Sharpen your pitching skills to deliver a strong pitch at any time. You will also gain insight into your company's strengths and weaknesses using the Pimento Map tool. 

Module 1: WHAT - Business model optimisation

Focus on the unique characteristics of your business and explore future growth opportunities.
Refine your unique value proposition (USP) to your customers. Evaluate your SME's strengths and weaknesses.
Work on your company's strategy.

Module 2: WHO – Your role alongside a strong team

Reflect on your role in the organisation: are you more likely to be a manager or an entrepreneur?
Define different growth paths for yourself and your team.
Consider who you need in your team and how you will recruit, motivate, and retain those people.
Develop actions for strong and effective team management.

Module 3: HOW – Optimize your business development and financial strategy

Attract more customers and/or select the right ones.
Consider the right sales strategy, with the right balance between sales cost and the expected results.
Get a better understanding of your figures and ask the right questions to your accountant.
Discover new ways to finance your growth.
Pillar 2: Individual counselling path
Application
Interact with our experts at the end of each bootcamp day to apply the management theory and tools into your own business. With the help of concrete reflection questions, you will immediately engage with the content.
Boardroom sessions
Present two of your main challenges, in an intimate setting, to some business coaches and other participants. Get hands-on input, advice, and support.
Final presentation
Pitch your business and action plan in front of a jury of experienced entrepreneurs. They will challenge you and help you on your way to optimization and business growth.

Optimise your business model and find an effective way to grow your business.

Reflect on your role as founder/business owner and continue to build a strong team.
Benefit from a sounding board of peers, faculty and experienced entrepreneurs.
Make decisions based on reasoned concepts.
Over the last three decades, more than 5000 entrepreneurs have participated in our programmes.
WHO SHOULD ATTEND
Ambitious founders and managing partners of small companies in the post-start-up phase;
Managing a team of 2 to 12 full-time employees;

Successful entrepreneurship is all about ambition and having the right attitude. So, there are no formal education requirements for this programme. However, you need to be willing to work on your organisation rather than in it, learn from best practice, reflect on your role as an entrepreneur and listen to feedback from experts and peers.

title: ENTREPRENEURIAL BUYOUT ACADEMY
description:
Do you dream of being manager of your own company – where you can put your entrepreneurial spirit and business knowledge and experience to good use? Taking over an existing company could be the ideal way to make your entrepreneurial dream come true. 

But before you dive in, it’s essential to ask the right questions. This programme gives you exceptional value for money. You’ll live and learn practical approaches – so you have the confidence to make the leap and buy.

sections.heading: Module 1: Why buy a company? And how do you find the right company?
sections.content:
Our aging population means there are increasing numbers of SMEs in need of capable new owners. If you’re thinking of buying in – or buying out – this programme will give you the skills and frameworks to leap with confidence.

Over seven evening modules, you’ll learn practical approaches that you can implement immediately. And you’ll work on your own buyout case and present it to a panel of bankers, private equity players and entrepreneurs. These seven modules represent the chronological steps that you must take to achieve a successful buy-out or buy-in. 

Module 1: Why buy a company? And how do you find the right company?  
Discover the essential questions to ask yourself before you start 
Understand where and how to find suitable targets 
Explore how to view paperwork critically – including confidentiality (non-disclosure) agreements (NDA) and letters of intent (LOI) 
Module 2: Valuation 
Know how much you should pay – and understand different valuation methods 
Learn how to build an LBO model to calculate your ROI 
Explore the challenges and pitfalls when valuing a target company 
Module 3: Business plan, value creation and due diligence 
Learn to play with sources of value creation in the short and long term 
Discover the steps in a good due diligence process – and know how to minimise risks 
Understand how to deal with legal, financial and fiscal issues 
Module 4: Financing 
Learn how to structure the deal  
Understand how to optimise financing costs and minimise risks   
Discover how to convince banks – and what they pay attention to 
Explore the role private equity can play 
Module 5: Transaction 
Discover the legal framework for buyouts – and what you need to pay attention to 
Learn how to best work with advisors 
Explore the safeguards and guarantees to negotiate with the seller 
Module 6: Negotiation techniques
Learn essential negotiation techniques for buying a company
Understand how to reach a good agreement
Discover how to win the seller’s trust
Module 7: Post-transaction
Learn to run an SME
Know how to install new management and develop a new strategy
Discover how to draw up a 100-day plan
Explore typical pitfalls
OUR PARTNERS
OTHER GUEST SPEAKERS AND EXPERTS

Lieven Stas (VD&P), Aelbrecht Van Damme (The Harbour), Kristoph Wauters (Bank van Breda) and more.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

Our aging population means there are increasing numbers of SMEs in need of capable new owners. If you’re thinking of buying in – or buying out – this programme will give you the skills and frameworks to leap with confidence.

Over seven evening modules, you’ll learn practical approaches that you can implement immediately. And you’ll work on your own buyout case and present it to a panel of bankers, private equity players and entrepreneurs. These seven modules represent the chronological steps that you must take to achieve a successful buy-out or buy-in. 

Module 1: Why buy a company? And how do you find the right company?  
Discover the essential questions to ask yourself before you start 
Understand where and how to find suitable targets 
Explore how to view paperwork critically – including confidentiality (non-disclosure) agreements (NDA) and letters of intent (LOI) 
Module 2: Valuation 
Know how much you should pay – and understand different valuation methods 
Learn how to build an LBO model to calculate your ROI 
Explore the challenges and pitfalls when valuing a target company 
Module 3: Business plan, value creation and due diligence 
Learn to play with sources of value creation in the short and long term 
Discover the steps in a good due diligence process – and know how to minimise risks 
Understand how to deal with legal, financial and fiscal issues 
Module 4: Financing 
Learn how to structure the deal  
Understand how to optimise financing costs and minimise risks   
Discover how to convince banks – and what they pay attention to 
Explore the role private equity can play 
Module 5: Transaction 
Discover the legal framework for buyouts – and what you need to pay attention to 
Learn how to best work with advisors 
Explore the safeguards and guarantees to negotiate with the seller 
Module 6: Negotiation techniques
Learn essential negotiation techniques for buying a company
Understand how to reach a good agreement
Discover how to win the seller’s trust
Module 7: Post-transaction
Learn to run an SME
Know how to install new management and develop a new strategy
Discover how to draw up a 100-day plan
Explore typical pitfalls
OUR PARTNERS
OTHER GUEST SPEAKERS AND EXPERTS

Lieven Stas (VD&P), Aelbrecht Van Damme (The Harbour), Kristoph Wauters (Bank van Breda) and more.

You will receive practical, concrete insights that will help you grow your business and take it to a more professional level. The Excellence Lab is a confidential, informal forum for entrepreneurs to share their personal and professional experiences. Each session is led and moderated by experts, such as Vlerick professors and experienced entrepreneurs.

The Excellence Lab is intended for entrepreneurs who have taken part in one of Vlerick's long-term programmes. We put each peer group together with the utmost care to ensure a powerful learning experience for all members. This programme takes 1 year to complete.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

Taking your company to that next level of professionalisation and growth is not always a bed of roses. It’s a work in progress, and that's where the Excellence Lab comes in! You will gain appropriate insights that will further support both your personal and professional development.

This programme is made up of 7 modules, spread over 1 year:

In these seven modules, we cover the latest management theories, models and tools to help you further professionalise and grow your business. Through new methodologies, case studies and discussions with other participants, you will learn how to apply these models within your own business.

Module 1: Purpose & sustainability: how to get started

You will learn how to better integrate social, environmental and corporate governance elements into your overall mission
You will get to understand what value you can offer to different stakeholders and what the world would be missing if you were not around
Through material analysis, you will be able to identify and prioritise the issues that are most important to your organisation

Module 2: Strategy implementation: getting everyone moving in the same direction

We will take a look at where you are now and where it is you want to go – and most importantly, how you want to get there
You will consider how you can bring about effective and lasting change
You will translate your strategy into specific milestones, actions and objectives across the company (people, processes and resources)

Module 3: Change Management: what to do about resistance

You will uncover the rational and emotional sides that come with a project of change
You will explore the actions needed to trigger change within your organisation
You will learn what role you can take to spearhead major change within your organisation
You will figure out how to get every stakeholder on board
You will discover how to anticipate during processes of change

Module 4: Growth financing options: all options

You will get an overview of all financing options, with or without the need for a bank loan

Module 5: Boardroom sessions*

Together with our Entrepreneurs in Residence, you will take part in a dedicated boardroom session
These sessions cover topics such as mergers and acquisitions, digital marketing, CRM, sustainability and finance. Simply choose the topic that is most relevant to you.
During the sounding board sessions, you will receive detailed and honest feedback on your specific problem areas

*This module is part of V-Entrepreneurs, a wider entrepreneurial ecosystem organised by Vlerick.

Module 6: Lonely at the top: the person behind the entrepreneur

Discover your own authentic leadership style
You will learn to become mindful of your own needs, resilience, flexibility and the energy you need to run your business
You will learn to stand tall in the face of adversity, keeping your mental resilience and emotions in check
You will reflect on your leadership qualities and how you lead your employees and your company
Through leading by example, you will motivate your team to perform even better

Module 7: Efficiency gains: using the right processes, systems and data (reporting)

What core processes, systems and data sets do you need to professionalise your business?
You will map out your company's value stream
You will learn how to measure operational performance, and how to link operational and financial KPIs
You will learn how to track and adjust how your strategy is being executed by using dashboards

From theory into practice!

Throughout each module, an owner-entrepreneur will tell you their story, linking it to the theme of that module. Afterwards, you will get the chance to participate in an interactive Q&A session. Then, you discuss together what challenges there are around implementation, with plenty of room for valuable feedback.

In these seven modules, we cover the latest management theories, models and tools to help you further professionalise and grow your business. Through new methodologies, case studies and discussions with other participants, you will learn how to apply these models within your own business.

Module 1: Purpose & sustainability: how to get started

You will learn how to better integrate social, environmental and corporate governance elements into your overall mission
You will get to understand what value you can offer to different stakeholders and what the world would be missing if you were not around
Through material analysis, you will be able to identify and prioritise the issues that are most important to your organisation

Module 2: Strategy implementation: getting everyone moving in the same direction

We will take a look at where you are now and where it is you want to go – and most importantly, how you want to get there
You will consider how you can bring about effective and lasting change
You will translate your strategy into specific milestones, actions and objectives across the company (people, processes and resources)

Module 3: Change Management: what to do about resistance

You will uncover the rational and emotional sides that come with a project of change
You will explore the actions needed to trigger change within your organisation
You will learn what role you can take to spearhead major change within your organisation
You will figure out how to get every stakeholder on board
You will discover how to anticipate during processes of change

Module 4: Growth financing options: all options

You will get an overview of all financing options, with or without the need for a bank loan

Module 5: Boardroom sessions*

Together with our Entrepreneurs in Residence, you will take part in a dedicated boardroom session
These sessions cover topics such as mergers and acquisitions, digital marketing, CRM, sustainability and finance. Simply choose the topic that is most relevant to you.
During the sounding board sessions, you will receive detailed and honest feedback on your specific problem areas

*This module is part of V-Entrepreneurs, a wider entrepreneurial ecosystem organised by Vlerick.

Module 6: Lonely at the top: the person behind the entrepreneur

Discover your own authentic leadership style
You will learn to become mindful of your own needs, resilience, flexibility and the energy you need to run your business
You will learn to stand tall in the face of adversity, keeping your mental resilience and emotions in check
You will reflect on your leadership qualities and how you lead your employees and your company
Through leading by example, you will motivate your team to perform even better

Module 7: Efficiency gains: using the right processes, systems and data (reporting)

What core processes, systems and data sets do you need to professionalise your business?
You will map out your company's value stream
You will learn how to measure operational performance, and how to link operational and financial KPIs
You will learn how to track and adjust how your strategy is being executed by using dashboards

From theory into practice!

Throughout each module, an owner-entrepreneur will tell you their story, linking it to the theme of that module. Afterwards, you will get the chance to participate in an interactive Q&A session. Then, you discuss together what challenges there are around implementation, with plenty of room for valuable feedback.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

The programme focuses on two crucial elements: the family and the assets. In terms of family, we are referring to succession, previous/current/next generations, family cohesion and dynamics, active versus non-active family members, family governance, development of human capital, purpose and more. In relation to assets, our focus is on wealth planning & management, direct and indirect investment strategies, philanthropy, impact investing, etc. This programme takes a deep-dive into how a professionally managed Family Office aims to amass different types of capital: financial, but also human, intellectual, social and emotional. Explicit attention is devoted to the added societal value that a Family Office can deliver alongside its capital management (through a purpose-driven strategy).

Module 1 – The Family Office approach: family & assets

An introduction to the Family Office landscape in Belgium and abroad. When do you start a Family Office? What is the goal of a Family Office? How do you organise a Family Office? Which models are there? What are the essential governance aspects of a Family Office? What types of capital can a Family Office help to develop? The emphasis lies on different practical examples, both local and international. Alongside this, specific attention is paid to networks. 

Module 2 – Family dynamics and emotions: how do you align different interests and determine your purpose-driven Family Office strategy? 

Families grow with each new generation. The risk of family assets being destroyed has little to do with money, but primarily with worsening relations as a result of other priorities and a lack of internal alignment. How can you align complex dynamics and varying objectives, and transform these into a shared, purpose-driven Family Office strategy? How can you establish structures and practices to move from an individual (‘I’) to a collective (‘we’) vision, so that the assets can remain across the generations in the family? This module is particularly relevant from a societal perspective and focuses on the family within the Family Office.

Module 3 – Investment options and organisation of financial assets across the generations

Healthy financial management of assets is an essential task for a Family Office. What are the pros and cons of different investment options (e.g. direct versus indirect investments, public versus private markets, bonds versus shares, impact investing), and how do you optimise the spread of your assets? How do you implement an investment strategy? Do you work with partners or organise everything in-house? How do you translate a purpose-driven Family Office strategy into an investment strategy? What are the advantages and disadvantages of different investment options?

Module 4 – (Cross-generational) Governance structure, communication and lifecycle of a Family Office

What are the foundations of a professional governance structure? What steps are possible to safeguard a professional governance structure for a Family Office? How can you establish healthy decision-making structures to align different interests? We look at the governing bodies of a Family Office, including the family council, board of directors, investment committee and the Family Office management team. We deep-dive into the organisation of these bodies, paying attention to formal structures (e.g. rules around selection of members, reward policy), informal structures and practices (e.g. rituals and traditions). Additionally, we pay specific attention to the development of a Family Office's human, intellectual and social capital. We look in depth at culture management across generations.

Module 5 – Managing direct investments

Direct investment in businesses is an important strategy to create value as an investor. What are the challenges around directly investing in different types of businesses (e.g. start-ups versus buy-outs)? How can you structure such investments? What role can a holding company play? What governance-related challenges are there with such investments? What is the competitive advantage of a Family Office over other direct investors?

Module 6 – Intervision

The participants present their long-term Family Office strategy and related actions. What insights have they gained? How are they going to get to work on this? What is their action plan?

description: The lightspeed evolution of software architecture, AI agents, and cloud scalability calls for a new breed of tech leaders who not only master complexity, but also drive innovation at the intersection of technology, business needs, and organizational growth. We want to empower our ecosystem’s leaders to build global winners. That’s where the Engineering Leadership Programme comes in.

sections.heading: Pillar 1 – Architecture & Scalability
sections.content:
This program is built for tomorrow’s tech leaders ready to move beyond daily execution toward becoming strategic, business-minded agents of change who drive technology as a lever for growth and boost teams to develop tomorrow’s competitive advantage. Our program will empower future tech leaders with hands-on insights into technology strategy,team leadership, scaling architecture, high-performing teams and engineering culture.

The programme is structured around 3 categories of leadership challenges translated in 10 interactive courses brought to life by frontrunning tech leaders:

Pillar 1 – Architecture & Scalability
Turning Technical Vision into Organisational Buy-In
Architecture at Every Stage of a Company
Technology Choices That Scale
Simplexity: Designing for Scale
Pillar 2 – Performance & Culture
Performance & Observability
Security & Multi-Tenancy
Pillar 3 – Strategy & Leadership
AI Integration
Scalable UX
Scaling Engineering Organizations
Future Trends in Software Architecture

Explore how emerging tech — from AI to cloud-native systems — is reshaping software. You’ll learn how to lead through technical change, design scalable systems, and build engineering cultures that grow with you.

Format: each of the ten sessions (running from September to June) follows a proven, interactive structure designed for deep learning & real-world application.

Every session embeds impact learning and great moments of networking & hospitality at the iconic Wintercircus. The course's format includes:

Guest tech leaders share a “war story” – a real technical or leadership challenge they’ve faced, followed by a class peer breakout, to engineer their solution
Class debrief & Unfolding of the case – solutions are shared the expert shares how the challenge was tackled and what they learned
In depth Q&A with the moderator, expert and reflection participants, diving deeper into decisions, trade-offs and lessons 
Informal peer exchange and frameworks to apply in your own context

Live Q&A: a participant-driven discussion that connects the case to individual realities and cross-company hurdles.

PRACTICAL INFO

The Engineering Leadership Program is a one year peer-led, practice-based leadership program for senior engineers, tech leads, and architects. 10 in-person, live sessions from September to June, held every Thursday or Friday morning, each month from September to June, including 3 exclusive networking events and a graduation ceremony and celebration.

1. Online application

Begin your journey by completing an online application. You’ll be asked to upload your CV, explain your motivation, and describe a key engineering or technical challenge you’re currently facing. This challenge will not only help us tailor your intake interview, it will also be brought during the program to connect theory with your real-world context and focus. Applications are reviewed continuously, so we recommend applying early to secure your place.

2. A personal conversation

Step two is a live, 1-hourintake interview with the program lead. Together, we’ll explore your experience,the communicated challenges and link these to the program, and leadership goals—so we can bridge with the program’s cases & peer groups,to your specific context. This ensures a highly relevant and engaging journey from day one.

3. Confirmation & registration

The final step is the formal registration form to confirm your individual seat in the program. You’ll have two weeks to complete and return the form. Upon confirmation, we’ll issue the invoice with a standard paymentterm of 30 calendar days. Your spot is fully secured once paymentis received. As spots are limited to 30.

title: SCALE-UP MASTERCLASS
description: Ready to grow your company? Then skip the trial-and-error stage and learn directly from people who’ve already been on the journey. Managing a fast-growing company is a challenging task that demands an enormous amount of knowledge and time. The Scale-Up Masterclass is a programme for founders and C-level executives. This unique learning experience will help you prepare to leap into the fast-paced world of high-growth scale-ups and will have a long-term impact on your company, yourself and your team. When joining, you become part of a close-knit community of like-minded European leaders - and you'll learn what it takes to bring a young company to the next level.

sections.heading: Module 1: Go-to-market strategy and international sales (face-to-face)
sections.content:
There are 3 face-to-face modules accompanied by individual coaching sessions and several online modules to work through at your own pace. In addition to this, you will develop a concrete personal action plan for your company. An in-company project and the Vlerick Growth Scan©, will help you apply the learnings.

Module 1: Go-to-market strategy and international sales (face-to-face) 
Explore international markets to expand your customer base
Assess the fit of different international markets
Decide whether to have an HQ – or decentralise your organisation 
Learn how to accelerate your sales process and shorten sales cycles
Find out how to implement customer-first culture 
Discover how to build a winning sales team 
Module 2: People, performance management, marketing and PR (face-to-face)
Evaluate your culture - and how employee behaviour aligns with it
Understand how to attract and retain the right people - and encourage the right behaviour
Build a values-aligned HR approach in your company
Discover how a PR and communications strategy can impact growth
Boost your online presence with our digital dashboard
Module 3: Bringing it all together (face-to-face)
Apply everything you’ve learned to a business or strategic challenge in your own organisation
Go deeper with group and individual coaching – and get feedback and practical guidance from experts and peers
Develop a strategic business plan and roadmap – with goals, actions and milestones
Online module: Product management organisation 
Learn to develop product roadmaps
Understand product team roles and responsibilities
Dive into data-driven decision-making 

Delivered by Tom Dejonghe (Collibra) and Katie Madding (Sensemitter) 

Online module: Raising finance and interacting with investors 
Discover why you need a board of directors 
Learn to create value with your board 
Develop a long-term vision for your company
Understand how to manage the investors on your board

Delivered by Dave Berkus (Berkus Tech Ventures) and Sophie Manigart (Vlerick Business School)

Online module: Emerging technologies

When joining, you become part of a close-knit community of like-minded European leaders - and you'll learn what it takes to bring a young company to the next level.

title: SME EXCELLENCE
description: You’ve built a thriving business that’s running at full capacity. You’re both the driving force and the strategist of the company. You’re also keeping a tight rein on things at operational level. It's a lot to deal with. Do you dream of delegating work and making the business less dependent on you? Is it time to invest in management, people and systems so that your SME can keep growing and prospering? This 10-day, programme gives you the support and insights you need to take your business to the next level. With the help of Vlerick experts, peers and business coaches, you’ll develop a business plan that provides a bridge between strategy and daily practice – and that gives you solid foundations to further professionalise and grow your company.

sections.heading: TRACK 1: MANAGEMENT EDUCATION
sections.content:
This 10-day programme is structured around three pillars. The first is made up of management training with practice-oriented sessions where you apply management theory, models and tools to your own company. The second is an individual coaching programme by business coaches and experts. The third is access to the unique Vlerick learning network of fellow entrepreneurs and the wider Vlerick ecosystem for lifelong learning. You’ll also use the Vlerick Growth Scan to identify the soft spots in your management you can still work on. Then you’ll refine your personal vision for growing your business in a sustainable way.

You’ll also use Vlerick’s 360° growth capability scan to identify the management areas you need to work on. Then you’ll refine your personal vision for growing your business in a sustainable way. 

There are two tracks to follow: 

TRACK 1: MANAGEMENT EDUCATION 
Module 1: Entrepreneurship, growth and strategy 
Understand why strategy is as important as daily operations 
Assess your business model and begin to plan a winning strategy 
Identify your growth phase and the challenges that come with it  
Explore the capabilities you need to achieve sustainable growth 
Visualise the process to translate your strategy into operational KPIs and actions – using tools including Strategy Mapping and Balanced Scorecard 
Module 2: Marketing, sales, and digitisation
Discover how to set up and develop a sales strategy, including performance metrics 
Learn to proactively manage your sales pipeline by evaluating the resources and people you need to meet your targets
Become more customer centric and develop a unique value proposition 
Identify technology that can add value to your business
Module 3: Leadership and people management
Reflect on your leadership skills – and identify areas to improve
Learn to customise your approach to motivate your employees to perform better
Examine how to attract the ‘right’ employees to your organisation
Explore ways to keep talented employees on board – and coach them along the way
Learn to say yes to delegating responsibilities, as well as outsourcing tasks
Module 4: Financial management
Learn to interpret your financials and evaluate your company’s financial health
Understand the questions to ask financial advisors so you can improve financial reporting
TRACK 2: BUSINESS SUPPORT
Carry out a thorough analysis of your current business practices – including your own management performance
Draw up a strategic business plan that maps out your company’s future plans – and translates them into milestones, actions and objectives 
Get expert, tailored advice from a unique panel of experienced business coaches and experts
Take part in three individual coaching sessions – and come away with a concrete business plan for your sme

DETAILED PROGRAMME

This 10-day programme is structured around three pillars. The first is made up of management training with practice-oriented sessions where you apply management theory, models and tools to your own company. The second is an individual coaching programme by business coaches and experts. The third is access to the unique Vlerick learning network of fellow entrepreneurs and the wider Vlerick ecosystem for lifelong learning. You’ll also use the Vlerick Growth Scan to identify the soft spots in your management you can still work on. Then you’ll refine your personal vision for growing your business in a sustainable way.

You’ll also use Vlerick’s 360° growth capability scan to identify the management areas you need to work on. Then you’ll refine your personal vision for growing your business in a sustainable way. 

There are two tracks to follow: 

TRACK 1: MANAGEMENT EDUCATION 
Module 1: Entrepreneurship, growth and strategy 
Understand why strategy is as important as daily operations 
Assess your business model and begin to plan a winning strategy 
Identify your growth phase and the challenges that come with it  
Explore the capabilities you need to achieve sustainable growth 
Visualise the process to translate your strategy into operational KPIs and actions – using tools including Strategy Mapping and Balanced Scorecard 
Module 2: Marketing, sales, and digitisation
Discover how to set up and develop a sales strategy, including performance metrics 
Learn to proactively manage your sales pipeline by evaluating the resources and people you need to meet your targets
Become more customer centric and develop a unique value proposition 
Identify technology that can add value to your business
Module 3: Leadership and people management
Reflect on your leadership skills – and identify areas to improve
Learn to customise your approach to motivate your employees to perform better
Examine how to attract the ‘right’ employees to your organisation
Explore ways to keep talented employees on board – and coach them along the way
Learn to say yes to delegating responsibilities, as well as outsourcing tasks
Module 4: Financial management
Learn to interpret your financials and evaluate your company’s financial health
Understand the questions to ask financial advisors so you can improve financial reporting
TRACK 2: BUSINESS SUPPORT
Carry out a thorough analysis of your current business practices – including your own management performance
Draw up a strategic business plan that maps out your company’s future plans – and translates them into milestones, actions and objectives 
Get expert, tailored advice from a unique panel of experienced business coaches and experts
Take part in three individual coaching sessions – and come away with a concrete business plan for your sme

To apply for this programme, you need to complete four steps:

1. Check your eligibility: Check if you meet the admissions criteria for the programme you want to apply for.

3. Take part in an interview: When we receive your application, we’ll get in touch to set up an interview. This will take about an hour and will cover:

Your professional experience and current challenges
Your career ambitions
Why you want to take the programme
Which electives are right for you (if the programme includes electives)

4. Confirm your registration: If you pass the interview, we’ll send you a registration form. You’ll have two weeks to complete and submit the form to confirm your programme place.
