You’ve built a thriving business that’s running at full capacity. You’re both the driving force and the strategist of the company. You’re also keeping a tight rein on things at operational level. It's a lot to deal with. Do you dream of delegating work and making the business less dependent on you? Is it time to invest in management, people and systems so that your SME can keep growing and prospering? This 10-day, programme gives you the support and insights you need to take your business to the next level. With the help of Vlerick experts, peers and business coaches, you’ll develop a business plan that provides a bridge between strategy and daily practice – and that gives you solid foundations to further professionalise and grow your company.

title: SME TRANSITION
description: Your life’s work has been building your SME. And then the time comes: you want to sell it, transfer it, or enter into a merger. Detailed preparation is key to making the transition successful and profitable. This programme gives you the understanding and approaches you need to complete a satisfactory transfer or sale and a valuable opportunity to have your plans scrutinised by a board of lawyers, advisors, bankers and experts.

sections.heading: PREPARE FOR A SUCCESSFUL TRANSFER OR SALE OF YOUR COMPANY
sections.content:
SME TRANSITION
PREPARE FOR A SUCCESSFUL TRANSFER OR SALE OF YOUR COMPANY

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Taking the first steps
sections.content:
The SME Transition programme focuses on the essential insights you need to achieve a smooth transfer or sale of your company. 

Each module finishes with specific assignments to apply to your own company. There are five modules that take you on a step-by-step journey – and an optional sixth module that covers family business transfers and sales. You’ll learn from guest speakers who’ve been through the journey themselves – and you’ll share experiences with fellow participants.

By the end of the programme, you’ll have a well-developed transition plan – which you’ll present to a panel of lawyers, advisors, bankers and Vlerick professors. 

Module 1: Taking the first steps
Explore whether to opt for a family transfer or sale
Discover whether a partial sale or phased exit could be an option
Understand the state of the M&A market – and how to find a buyer
Develop a practical step-by-step plan – and know how investors view your company
Delve into getting the most from professional guidance
Discover how to raise the value of your company
Module 2: What is your company worth? 
Understand the price you can realistically expect
Explore alternative valuation methods
Know the pitfalls to avoid
Discover how to get the highest price
Module 3 – Leadership and transition
Know what it takes to lead in a transition phase
Understand the role of an external manager in facilitating a transfer
Discover how to work with advisors
Module 4: Mastering negotiations
Explore how to achieve a win-win situation
Discover the negotiation techniques you’ll need to achieve it
Understand how to win the buyer’s trust
Know how to avoid family conflicts
Module 5: Optional – Family transfer and sale
Understand how to avoid conflict
Discover how to set up family governance structures
Define who will take on which role
Explore private equity as an option
Know who you’ll sell your company to – and why
Get to grips with succession and estate planning – as well as the tax implications of family transfer
Explore long-term wealth management 
Module 6: Get expert feedback on your plan
Present your plan to a panel of lawyers, advisors, bankers and Vlerick professors
Use their advice to finesse your approach
Finish the programme with a concrete plan and a thorough understanding of how to succeed
OUR PARTNERS

title: ADVANCED MANAGEMENT PROGRAMME
description:
The challenges and opportunities facing your company are ever-changing. Which means you need leadership skills that can drive competitive advantage, no matter what the future holds. Over the course of one year, this 16-day general management programme is a transformative experience that allows you to reframe your leadership role and strategic thinking. 

If you’re looking for a senior management programme that opens your mind, boosts effectiveness and transforms your leadership approach, the Advanced Management Programme is for you.

sections.heading: BECOME A BETTER STRATEGIC LEADER
sections.content:
ADVANCED MANAGEMENT PROGRAMME
BECOME A BETTER STRATEGIC LEADER

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Your strategic arena
sections.content:
In a world where change is the only constant, you must challenge your thinking and broaden your strategic perspective, for yourself and your company. The Advanced Management Programme aims for precisely that: lasting impact. Think of it as a transformative general management programme for senior managers. In synergy with a group of high-calibre participants, we will redefine your leadership role and strategic mindset at different levels.

The Advanced Management Programme is founded on two pillars – strategic decision-making and your role as a leader. The programme takes you on a journey that reframes your entire way of thinking and your approach to leadership and makes them future-proof.

Module 1: Your strategic arena

We begin with a sharp focus on the winning strategy for your business environment. We outline the key elements needed to formulate that strategy effectively. What are the critical decisions you need to make when selecting your strategy? How do you craft a winning strategy? And how do you set yourself apart from other players in the same strategic arena?

The final part of this module focuses on strategy implementation, monitoring, and evaluation. What makes or breaks a successful strategic implementation? You’ll work with tools like strategy maps and scorecards, applying them to your own company during a simulation. This way, you can measure and track the success of your strategy.

After completing this module, you will meet with your sounding board group for an initial discussion on the scope of your strategic project.

Module 2: High-performance leadership 

In this module, you will reflect on your leadership role. What does impact mean, and how much influence do you have as a leader? This module also marks the start of your 360° feedback process, which you will later discuss with your sounding board group and a Vlerick professor. Additionally, we will explore organisational culture and structure.

In the second part, we will discuss how to drive change within your company. You will be introduced to a change model based on six organisational ‘batteries’. This model will help you manage both the tangible and intangible aspects of change more effectively.

Afterwards, you will receive your first project coaching from our faculty.

Module 3: Decision-making impact 

During the third module, you will dive into the various aspects of corporate finance essential for every senior executive—such as raising capital, capital budgeting, and business valuation. You will then sharpen your negotiation skills and develop a framework that elevates your negotiations to true win-win deals.

After this module, you will have dedicated time to meet with your advisory group. You can also take advantage of additional one-on-one project coaching from our faculty.

Module 4: Navigating trends 

In this module, we explore how you, as a leader, can respond to emerging global trends. We take a closer look at the impact of sustainability and digitalisation, summarising key sustainability models for you. Next, we address the implementation challenges and what they mean for your organisation.

We also focus on digital strategy, as the impact of digital technology cannot be underestimated. You will learn how to tackle digital challenges and use them to enhance your organisation’s competitiveness.

On the final day of this module, we will cover strategic integration—bringing together all strategic models in a final, concluding case study.

Closing module

We wrap up the programme in style with a graduation dinner. After completing your journey, you can schedule a one-on-one session with your Vlerick professor at a time of your choosing. The goal? To translate your insights into practice and unlock new opportunities to take your business to the next level

SUCCESS STORIES
STEFAAN LAUWERS

CEO at Partena Ziekenfonds

I’ve been the director of the Partena Health Insurance Fund since 1991. I've witnessed merger after merger. This means you must constantly question your raison d’être and modus operandi. I’m 59 years old, and was 57 when I did the Advanced Management Programme. The programme forces you to think and also to do. Your mindset is expanded, which means you start investing your energy at the right time in the right things.

PRACTICAL INFO

To apply for this programme, you need to complete four steps:

1. Check your eligibility: Check if you meet the admissions criteria for the programme you want to apply for.

2. Submit your application: Fill out the application form and upload it together with your cv or LinkedIn profile.

3. Take part in an interview: When we receive your application, we’ll get in touch to set up an interview. This will take about an hour and will cover:

Your professional experience and current challenges
Your career ambitions
Why you want to take the programme

4. Confirm your registration: If you pass the interview, we’ll send you a registration form. You’ll have two weeks to complete and submit the form to confirm your programme place.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

In a world where change is the only constant, you must challenge your thinking and broaden your strategic perspective, for yourself and your company. The Advanced Management Programme aims for precisely that: lasting impact. Think of it as a transformative general management programme for senior managers. In synergy with a group of high-calibre participants, we will redefine your leadership role and strategic mindset at different levels.

The Advanced Management Programme is founded on two pillars – strategic decision-making and your role as a leader. The programme takes you on a journey that reframes your entire way of thinking and your approach to leadership and makes them future-proof.

Module 1: Your strategic arena

We begin with a sharp focus on the winning strategy for your business environment. We outline the key elements needed to formulate that strategy effectively. What are the critical decisions you need to make when selecting your strategy? How do you craft a winning strategy? And how do you set yourself apart from other players in the same strategic arena?

The final part of this module focuses on strategy implementation, monitoring, and evaluation. What makes or breaks a successful strategic implementation? You’ll work with tools like strategy maps and scorecards, applying them to your own company during a simulation. This way, you can measure and track the success of your strategy.

After completing this module, you will meet with your sounding board group for an initial discussion on the scope of your strategic project.

Module 2: High-performance leadership 

In this module, you will reflect on your leadership role. What does impact mean, and how much influence do you have as a leader? This module also marks the start of your 360° feedback process, which you will later discuss with your sounding board group and a Vlerick professor. Additionally, we will explore organisational culture and structure.

In the second part, we will discuss how to drive change within your company. You will be introduced to a change model based on six organisational ‘batteries’. This model will help you manage both the tangible and intangible aspects of change more effectively.

Afterwards, you will receive your first project coaching from our faculty.

Module 3: Decision-making impact 

During the third module, you will dive into the various aspects of corporate finance essential for every senior executive—such as raising capital, capital budgeting, and business valuation. You will then sharpen your negotiation skills and develop a framework that elevates your negotiations to true win-win deals.

After this module, you will have dedicated time to meet with your advisory group. You can also take advantage of additional one-on-one project coaching from our faculty.

Module 4: Navigating trends 

In this module, we explore how you, as a leader, can respond to emerging global trends. We take a closer look at the impact of sustainability and digitalisation, summarising key sustainability models for you. Next, we address the implementation challenges and what they mean for your organisation.

We also focus on digital strategy, as the impact of digital technology cannot be underestimated. You will learn how to tackle digital challenges and use them to enhance your organisation’s competitiveness.

On the final day of this module, we will cover strategic integration—bringing together all strategic models in a final, concluding case study.

Closing module

We wrap up the programme in style with a graduation dinner. After completing your journey, you can schedule a one-on-one session with your Vlerick professor at a time of your choosing. The goal? To translate your insights into practice and unlock new opportunities to take your business to the next level

The programme will give you insights, tools and frameworks that will empower you to become a more effective and knowledgeable business leader. Throughout the programme, you can immediately apply your learnings in an in-company project - creating immediate value for you and your organisation.  

You can tailor your learning trajectory by selecting one or more electives (maximum 7 days): either you opt to dive deep into a topic from the core programme or you choose a new one. We gladly assist you in making the right choice.  

Winning with strategy

Learn strategic concepts and how to apply them
Develop your strategic thinking and reflect on your organisation’s strategic choices
Discover how to respond to competitive marketplaces with strategic innovation

(Self-)leadership 

Explore the dynamics of leadership, teamwork and culture – and reflect on your role in building a high-performance team 
Discover your leadership style through a 360° feedback tool , and create a personal development plan 
Learn how to use your full potential

Business mastery

Learn in depth about finance, digital innovation and change management
Discover the potential of cross-functional thinking – and how to increase your impact on your organisation 
Put your knowledge and team spirit into action during a business simulation  

Electives

Personalise your learning journey by selecting up to seven days from our short-term programmes : either dive into a new topic or deepen (one of) the topics of the core programme. Depending on the topic(s) you choose, you can do your electives before, during or after the core programme. You have two years to complete your programme.

In-company project 

Apply your new learnings to an in-company project – responding to a business or strategic challenge for your own organisation.

Apply your learning to a project from your own organisation
Use your fellow participants and our expert faculty as a sounding board
Create ROI for your organisation

title: MASTERING INTERIM MANAGEMENT
description:
Being an interim manager comes with its own unique challenges and opportunities. You often work in organisations going through change – and you need to make an impact and add value quickly. You also have to be resilient and self-sufficient. 

On this five-day programme you live and learn the approaches you need to align strategy, people and finance, so that you can make your mark and bring teams along with you. You also network and share experiences with other interim managers.

sections.heading: Module 1: Implementing a winning business strategy
sections.content:
Over an intense five days, you dive into four modules that have been designed to strengthen your approach and give you the skills to succeed in interim management.

You discover models and develop skills that help you understand each new business context quickly – and get traction as you implement strategy. You also meet and network with other professionals who share their experiences and insights of being interim managers. 

Module 1: Implementing a winning business strategy 
Learn to formulate a winning business strategy 
Know that strategy is the foundation for all activity 
Discover the importance of change management in successful strategy execution 
Module 2: Corporate performance management 
Gain a deeper understanding of the management control process 
Learn to translate strategy into action 
Know how to define key performance indicators that capture the strategic drivers of value 
Explore strategy mapping and the importance of the balanced scorecard in creating a strategy-focused organisation 
Module 3: Change management 
Explore the challenges of leading change 
Discover models for successful change management 
Learn to foster an adaptive culture – and the power of unlearning 
Learn how to be a role model for change 
Module 4: People management 
Understand what makes teams go the extra mile 
Discover how to build trust as an interim manager 
Understand how to deal with shifts in career expectations

Explore the challenges of leading change

Learn how to be a role model for change

Understand what makes teams go the extra mile 
Discover how to build trust as an interim manager

title: PROJECT MANAGEMENT
description:
In today’s complex world of work, effective project management is critical. This four-day programme gives you the tools, techniques and skills to successfully deliver projects and manage stakeholders. 

It helps project management professionals like you to manage people – and to encourage, help and steer teams to reach the finish line on time and on budget. You’ll live and learn new approaches in case simulations – so you’re ready to leap into project coordination in your own organisation.

sections.heading: Module 1: The fundamentals of project-based working
sections.content:
In four modules, you’ll discover how a project-based approach to working gives you flexibility, accountability and control – and you’ll gain project management insights and techniques that allow you to drive productivity.

Explore the differences between project management and portfolio management 
Discover how to link project-based working with organisational structure 
Understand potential project pitfalls and success factors  
Module 2: Project planning and network analysis 
Discover network planning techniques 
Learn to manage resources 
Dive into simulated cases on project performance and risk analysis 
Explore project planning software 
Module 3: Project performance management and project control 
Understand risk management and the project baseline schedule 
Explore project performance measurement and follow-up 
Module 4: Teamwork and people management skills  
Discover team building and interaction styles 
Understand how to communicate within a team 
Explore and assess your own strengths and weaknesses

title: MANAGEMENT FOR THE HOSPITAL PROFESSIONAL
description:
Hospitals face a number of challenges – from collaborating with other healthcare providers through to rapid digitalisation, patients spending less time in hospital and a greater focus on preventative healthcare. And all these challenges come with financial, strategic, organisational and human consequences. 

On this 15-day programme for doctors and hospital employees, you live and learn various aspects of hospital management – so you can leap confidently into contributing to your hospital’s policy.

sections.heading: Module 'The hospital sector from a macro perspective'
sections.content:
This programme consists of three five-day modules, three webinars – which include exercises, discussions, simulations and coaching – and a free ticket for the Vlerick Healthcare Conference. 

The module 'The hospital sector from a macro perspective' includes sector trends, the financial picture and strategic focus. 
The module 'Evaluating and improving value creation' investigates how you create value for patients in your own department – and how you can improve. 
The module 'Future-proofing your hospital' explores strategies for ensuring the long-term viability of your hospital by addressing contemporary challenges in the healthcare landscape.  

You can take the complete programme, or you can opt for one or two specific modules. If you participate in one  of the Management for the Hospital Professional modules, you will receive a 25% discount for each module you follow within three years.

Module 'The hospital sector from a macro perspective' 
Take part in a webinar on getting to grips with different healthcare systems  
Discover trends and innovations that will impact hospital services in the future 
Understand hospital financing and different sources of funding 
Explore financial management and a simulation to explain important financial concepts 
Dive into how financial management can help you make strategic decisions 
Learn about strategic healthcare plans and policy plans  

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'The hospital from a macro perspective' for more information.

Module 'Evaluating and improving value creation' 
Take part in a webinar on healthcare quality 
Discover value-based healthcare and the cost of healthcare 
Identify ways to improve hospital processes and offer better healthcare 
Explore change within the hospital context 
Dive into impactful communication with our coaches 
Learn to handle conflict with an effective conflict management strategy 

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'Evaluating and improving value creation' for more information.

Module 'Future-proofing your hospital'
Take part in a webinar on what the expectations of patients will be in the future
Explore how to develop and deploy a sustainability strategy for your hospital
Learn how transmural care can impact the whole healthcare ecosystem
Discover what digital transformation means for hospitals – and how to lead your team through it – in a two-day session
Learn to empower patients to drive better healthcare outcomes

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'Future-proofing your hospital' for more information.

The Vlerick Healthcare Conference

The Vlerick Healthcare Conference is a gathering of professionals from the wider healthcare sector – including doctors, hospital teams and pharmaceutical and medical technology organisations. It is built around a single theme, which is explored from a variety of perspectives through sessions, keynote speeches and a debate.

SUCCESS STORIES
ELISABETH DE WAELE

Head of Clinical Nutrition Department Intensivist UZ Brussel

In addition to gaining new insights, I wanted to be inspired. I wanted to acquire new skills and tips & tricks from the pros. I now understand better where my talents lie and which subjects, such as innovation and people management, fascinate me. I am also better able to recognise and analyze situations or challenges and approach them in a more structured way. 

AN BAEL

Paediatric Nephrologist at ZNA

One particular thing I learned is that to tackle the sticking points in paediatrics, you have to find like-minded people. The great advantage of the Vlerick programme is the network. Partly thanks to the course, I am now a member of many paediatric associations in Flanders and Belgium. It’s quite time-consuming, but probably the only way to really achieve something. I now feel like I really know what I’m talking about in several areas.

Hospitals face a number of challenges – from collaborating with other healthcare providers through to rapid digitalisation, patients spending less time in hospital and a greater focus on preventative healthcare. And all these challenges come with financial, strategic, organisational and human consequences. 

On this 15-day programme for doctors and hospital employees, you live and learn various aspects of hospital management – so you can leap confidently into contributing to your hospital’s policy.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

This programme consists of three five-day modules, three webinars – which include exercises, discussions, simulations and coaching – and a free ticket for the Vlerick Healthcare Conference. 

The module 'The hospital sector from a macro perspective' includes sector trends, the financial picture and strategic focus. 
The module 'Evaluating and improving value creation' investigates how you create value for patients in your own department – and how you can improve. 
The module 'Future-proofing your hospital' explores strategies for ensuring the long-term viability of your hospital by addressing contemporary challenges in the healthcare landscape.  

You can take the complete programme, or you can opt for one or two specific modules. If you participate in one  of the Management for the Hospital Professional modules, you will receive a 25% discount for each module you follow within three years.

Module 'The hospital sector from a macro perspective' 
Take part in a webinar on getting to grips with different healthcare systems  
Discover trends and innovations that will impact hospital services in the future 
Understand hospital financing and different sources of funding 
Explore financial management and a simulation to explain important financial concepts 
Dive into how financial management can help you make strategic decisions 
Learn about strategic healthcare plans and policy plans  

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'The hospital from a macro perspective' for more information.

Module 'Evaluating and improving value creation' 
Take part in a webinar on healthcare quality 
Discover value-based healthcare and the cost of healthcare 
Identify ways to improve hospital processes and offer better healthcare 
Explore change within the hospital context 
Dive into impactful communication with our coaches 
Learn to handle conflict with an effective conflict management strategy 

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'Evaluating and improving value creation' for more information.

Module 'Future-proofing your hospital'
Take part in a webinar on what the expectations of patients will be in the future
Explore how to develop and deploy a sustainability strategy for your hospital
Learn how transmural care can impact the whole healthcare ecosystem
Discover what digital transformation means for hospitals – and how to lead your team through it – in a two-day session
Learn to empower patients to drive better healthcare outcomes

Do you only want to participate in this module? Be sure to check 'Future-proofing your hospital' for more information.

The Vlerick Healthcare Conference

The Vlerick Healthcare Conference is a gathering of professionals from the wider healthcare sector – including doctors, hospital teams and pharmaceutical and medical technology organisations. It is built around a single theme, which is explored from a variety of perspectives through sessions, keynote speeches and a debate.

title: EXECUTIVE MASTER CERTIFICATE IN HUMAN RESOURCE MANAGEMENT
description:
Organisations are increasingly looking to their HR colleagues to act as strategic business partners – creating impact and value and actively driving success and growth. 

The Executive Master Certificate in Human Resource Management is a 12-day programme that empowers you to become this strategic partner. You learn new skills and put them into practice in a hands-on, strategic project for your own organisation. When you successfully complete the programme, you’ll be ready to take the leap and drive positive change for your business.

sections.heading: Module 1: Strategic HRM
sections.content:
The programme comprises five core modules – and each one focuses on a key aspect of human resource management. Through each one, you’ll gain the understanding and approaches you need to make impactful, strategic decisions. 

This world-class HRM programme also gives you an opportunity to gain immediate ROI for your organisation – with an in-company project. You’ll use it to tackle a pressing HR challenge in your organisation – all with the dedicated support of our expert faculty.

Module 1: Strategic HRM 
Distinguish the dynamic relationship between organisational behaviour, organisational design and HRM
Analyse the current dominant HR models and trains of thought in HR
Understand the dynamics of the labour market
Critically reflect upon the way your HR department in organised in your organisation
Evaluate the power and limitations of evidence-based HR   
Module 2: Strategic Talent and Career Management 
Analyse and evaluate your current recruitment and selection policies
Illustrate how employer branding could be applied in your organisation to develop a concrete employer value proposition
Understand the link between training and development and the HR strategy
Evaluate your own self-management triangle when making career choices
Apply the political metaphor on career systems by recognising dominant coalition dynamics 
Module 3: Strategic Competence and Performance Management 
Compose competency profiles based on jobs and people in the organisation
Assess your organisation’s approach to managing employee performance in the light of new trends
Design a performance management approach fitting organisational maturity and culture
Customise performance management based on the contribution and growth potential of individual employees
Module 4: Strategic Reward Management
Develop strategically inspired reward techniques and implement them in your company
Become familiar with practical concepts and tools to apply in remuneration schemes
Discover how to position rewards, as well as strategic embedding within the context of the organisation
Gain insight into the latest concepts in reward management
Module 5: Strategic Challenges for HR 
Recognise the implications of the hybrid way of working and assess how this can improve performance & commitment in your organisation
Interpret your organisation’s mindset, climate and conflict behaviour in order to optimise social dialogue in your organisation
Understand how digital strategy can be taken to the next level in HR with the use of AI

PRACTICAL INFO

To apply for this programme, you need to complete four steps:

1. Check your eligibility: Check if you meet the admissions criteria for the programme you want to apply for.

2. Submit your application: Fill out the application form and upload it together with your cv or LinkedIn profile.

3. Take part in an interview: When we receive your application, we’ll get in touch to set up an interview. This will take about an hour and will cover:

Your professional experience and current challenges
Your career ambitions
Why you want to take the programme
Which electives are right for you (if the programme includes electives)

4. Confirm your registration: If you pass the interview, we’ll send you a registration form. You’ll have two weeks to complete and submit the form to confirm your programme place.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

The programme comprises five core modules – and each one focuses on a key aspect of human resource management. Through each one, you’ll gain the understanding and approaches you need to make impactful, strategic decisions. 

This world-class HRM programme also gives you an opportunity to gain immediate ROI for your organisation – with an in-company project. You’ll use it to tackle a pressing HR challenge in your organisation – all with the dedicated support of our expert faculty.

Module 1: Strategic HRM 
Distinguish the dynamic relationship between organisational behaviour, organisational design and HRM
Analyse the current dominant HR models and trains of thought in HR
Understand the dynamics of the labour market
Critically reflect upon the way your HR department in organised in your organisation
Evaluate the power and limitations of evidence-based HR   
Module 2: Strategic Talent and Career Management 
Analyse and evaluate your current recruitment and selection policies
Illustrate how employer branding could be applied in your organisation to develop a concrete employer value proposition
Understand the link between training and development and the HR strategy
Evaluate your own self-management triangle when making career choices
Apply the political metaphor on career systems by recognising dominant coalition dynamics 
Module 3: Strategic Competence and Performance Management 
Compose competency profiles based on jobs and people in the organisation
Assess your organisation’s approach to managing employee performance in the light of new trends
Design a performance management approach fitting organisational maturity and culture
Customise performance management based on the contribution and growth potential of individual employees
Module 4: Strategic Reward Management
Develop strategically inspired reward techniques and implement them in your company
Become familiar with practical concepts and tools to apply in remuneration schemes
Discover how to position rewards, as well as strategic embedding within the context of the organisation
Gain insight into the latest concepts in reward management
Module 5: Strategic Challenges for HR 
Recognise the implications of the hybrid way of working and assess how this can improve performance & commitment in your organisation
Interpret your organisation’s mindset, climate and conflict behaviour in order to optimise social dialogue in your organisation
Understand how digital strategy can be taken to the next level in HR with the use of AI

sections.heading: Module 1: HRM as a strategic business partner
sections.content:
The business world is changing – and employee expectations with it. Organisations need to attract and retain the best talent – and boost performance. And it’s up to you to lead the way. This four-day programme helps you develop the knowledge and skills to assess your organisation’s current HR strategy – and to align it more effectively with business needs. 

You’ll live and learn the latest insights and practices in strategic HRM – and you’ll leave with the skills and confidence to leap into becoming a true business partner who can successfully lead your company’s strategy in HR. 

The Strategic HRM programme comprises four modules:

Module 1: HRM as a strategic business partner
Discover how to increase the impact of the Human Resource Management function
Learn how to link the HRM strategy to the corporate strategy
Explore the new HR architecture
Module 2: Talent management as a retention tool
Discover employer branding as a recruitment tool
Explore the career policies today’s organisations use to retain their talent
Learn how to manage high-potential employees – and succession 
Module 3: Strategic reward
Explore reward in the context of corporate culture, structure and strategy
Learn to develop an effective reward strategy for your organisation
Understand the dos and don’ts of reward systems in strategic human resource planning 
Module 4: Performance management
Explore the link between motivation and performance
Discover how HRM and line managers create performance management systems
Learn about the biggest challenges in performance management

title: NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
description:
Growing a business means constantly looking for new opportunities. But the chances of a new lead working out can be small. So how do you increase the success rate of new business activity? 

Over five days, you’ll live and learn strategies for growth, create an elevator pitch, assess the strengths and weaknesses of your business idea – and find out how to convince stakeholders. You’ll write a business plan that will create real impact for your business – and get feedback from faculty and peers.

sections.heading: DISCOVER HOW TO IDENTIFY AND VALIDATE NEW AND STRATEGIC BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES
sections.content:
NEW BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT
DISCOVER HOW TO IDENTIFY AND VALIDATE NEW AND STRATEGIC BUSINESS OPPORTUNITIES

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Exploring roads for growth
sections.content:
Over five game-changing days, you’ll develop a sound business plan – and gain the confidence to pitch your idea internally and to investors. You’ll learn to structure your proposal and build the right team to move it forward. Then you’ll present your ideas and get feedback from faculty and peers. 

Lectures, real-life cases, guest speakers and coaching are all focused on entrepreneurialism. Which means you’ll get the knowledge and skills you need to take your business development management to the next level. At the end of the programme, you’ll develop a robust plan to implement your new business idea. And you’ll get detailed feedback from faculty and peers. You’ll leave with an action plan in order to gather new revenue streams.

The New Business Development programme covers four modules:  

Module 1: Exploring roads for growth 
Define business development and why you need to invest in it 
Learn from intrapreneurs and entrepreneurs 
Discover the tools that help you identify opportunities for growth 
Dig deeper into new products/services/markets, exploring new channels, innovating at business model level and shaping partnerships  
Module 2: Defining your business model to grow
Map and visualise your business model to grow your business
Understand how to use “business model thinking” as a way to identify new growth opportunities
Understand how to deliver a confident elevator pitch
Module 3: Writing your business plan  
Discover the building blocks of a good business plan  
Uncover the dos and don’ts of writing a business plan 
Know how to map the financials of your new business idea  
Take a more structured approach to validating your growth opportunities
Discover how to conduct market research, assess your competitive edge, and evaluate feasibility
Module 4: Organising for execution 
Discover how to create internal buy-in for your idea 
Learn to manage a team and move your idea forward successfully 
Sounding-board: A half-day session to take your business plan to the next level
Present your own business case a couple of weeks after the modules. You’ll get detailed feedback from faculty and peers on how you can grow your business and gather new revenue streams.
Discover how other professionals and organisations tackle similar questions/challenges.

title: BRAND MANAGEMENT
description:
Securing customer loyalty in today’s competitive landscape can be hard work. So how do you make your brand stand out? Today's challenges are as diverse as digitisation, information overload, social responsibility and increasing consumer scepticism.

This three-day programme gives you the skills to successfully manage and build your brand portfolio – and the insights to think as a forward-looking marketer.

HOW TO SUCCESSFULLY BUILD AND MANAGE BRANDS

sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Fundamental branding perspectives
sections.content:
Redefine your brand strategy through the programme’s three modules. Live and learn branding as you start with a module on the fundamentals of branding. You discover how to manage and communicate a brand through different perspectives. Then you discover creative branding techniques for our digital age.

You’ll be inspired by our blend of academic rigour and direct experience from the marketplace. You’ll hear B2B and B2C professionals from large and small companies share their experiences of successful branding projects. And at the end of the programme, you’ll be ready to leap confidently into your own successful branding challenges and projects.

Module 1: Fundamental branding perspectives
Discover the classic branding concepts and frameworks
Learn how to build strong brands
Get to know concepts to generate brand identity and brand positioning
Discover core brand communication and key performance indicators
Module 2: Newer branding principles
Explore and learn to apply different perspectives to build brands that form new media possibilities, an emotional-vs-rational route to branding, and/or a prioritisation of attracting or keeping customers.
Discover perspectives that:
… start from working with brand influencers
… prioritise emotional bonding
… focus first on creating special touchpoint experiences
… stipulate that being noticed by as many potential customers as possible is key
Module 3: Additional aspects of creating, communicating & managing brands* 
Learn how to build a brand architecture
Understand which non-traditional, creative tactics are popular for communicating brands  
Find out how to create or update brand logos, names, slogans
Discover how to grow/leverage a brand using brand extension and co-branding strategies

*sub-topics are examples of content blocks discussed during the final section of the programme

Securing customer loyalty in today’s competitive landscape can be hard work. So how do you make your brand stand out? Today's challenges are as diverse as digitisation, information overload, social responsibility and increasing consumer scepticism.

This three-day programme gives you the skills to successfully manage and build your brand portfolio – and the insights to think as a forward-looking marketer.

DETAILED PROGRAMME

Redefine your brand strategy through the programme’s three modules. Live and learn branding as you start with a module on the fundamentals of branding. You discover how to manage and communicate a brand through different perspectives. Then you discover creative branding techniques for our digital age.

You’ll be inspired by our blend of academic rigour and direct experience from the marketplace. You’ll hear B2B and B2C professionals from large and small companies share their experiences of successful branding projects. And at the end of the programme, you’ll be ready to leap confidently into your own successful branding challenges and projects.

Module 1: Fundamental branding perspectives
Discover the classic branding concepts and frameworks
Learn how to build strong brands
Get to know concepts to generate brand identity and brand positioning
Discover core brand communication and key performance indicators
Module 2: Newer branding principles
Explore and learn to apply different perspectives to build brands that form new media possibilities, an emotional-vs-rational route to branding, and/or a prioritisation of attracting or keeping customers.
Discover perspectives that:
… start from working with brand influencers
… prioritise emotional bonding
… focus first on creating special touchpoint experiences
… stipulate that being noticed by as many potential customers as possible is key
Module 3: Additional aspects of creating, communicating & managing brands* 
Learn how to build a brand architecture
Understand which non-traditional, creative tactics are popular for communicating brands  
Find out how to create or update brand logos, names, slogans
Discover how to grow/leverage a brand using brand extension and co-branding strategies

title: CUSTOMER CENTRICITY
description: When an organisation takes a customer-centric approach, it can boost customer satisfaction, loyalty, revenues and profits. But what does customer centricity really mean? On this four-day programme, you’ll live and learn what truly customer-driven strategy looks like – and get the skills and confidence to leap into implementing it.

sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Customer-driven innovation
sections.content:
This programme brings together theoretical concepts, case studies, techniques and practical examples to highlight the power of putting customers at the centre of your organisation. You’ll learn from top faculty and expert practitioners. And you’ll share customer experience management ideas with your fellow participants. 

Over five modules, you’ll gain the knowledge and insights to create and implement a customer-centric strategy in your organisation. At the end of the programme, you’ll develop a robust plan how to put your customer in the centre of your organisation. And you’ll get detailed feedback from faculty and peers. You’ll leave with a truly customer centric strategy for your own organisation.

Module 1: Customer-driven innovation
Learn how to connect with customers during the innovation process
Explore the process of developing products and services for wider customer needs
Dive into co-creating best practices in digital and physical industries
Module 2: Better customer understanding
Discover how to get a 360 degree customer view
Learn how decision-making can take you from customer big data to customer insights
Dive into predictive analytics for digital communications and marketing campaigns
Module 3: Customer journey thinking
Gain insights into customer psychology – with deep-dive perspectives to apply to customer journey thinking
Experience how digital technology can change how you bring a product or service to customers and create a competitive advantage
Explore real-life examples of successful customer journey approaches driven by Artificial Intelligence (AI) and big data
Module 4: A customer and innovation-focused culture
Discover how to build a customer-focused culture.
Explore successful strategies for overcoming internal resistance to foster innovation
Learn how to build a culture of innovation, collaboration, and risk-taking
Module 5: Capturing value through innovative pricing
Define a value-based pricing strategy in line with your company objectives
Learn to maximise the value of interactions with customers
Explore how start-up pricing and digital natives can inspire established companies
Sounding board: A half-day session to take your business strategy to the next level
Implement what you’ve learned in your own project
Introduce your challenge to Vlerick experts and your peers – and gain valuable feedback
Discover how other professionals and organisations tackle similar questions/challenges

This programme is divided into eight modules. Each one takes you deeper into the Six Batteries change model – from understanding to applying it in your own organisation.

Module 1: Introduction to change

Explore the history of change management and various approaches
Get to know the Kotter model, Lewin model and ADKAR approach

Module 2: Your role within change

Think about how change works at your place of work and what role you might play within change

Module 3: Six Batteries of Change

Discover why change is a dynamic process
Dive into the Six Batteries of Change model
Understand how it applies to your organisation 

Module 4: The rational batteries

Explore the rational batteries in detail 

Module 5: The emotional batteries

Explore the rational batteries in details

Module 6: Applying the Six Batteries model

Dive into a practical case

Module 7: Implementing the framework

Reflect on your role in your organisation

Module 8: Conclusion

Evaluate what you've learned during the programme
Create a plan for how you'll use your new knowledge to contribute to your organisation

This online learning journey includes videos, exercises, quizzes, case studies and real-life examples to keep you engaged and motivated. You’ll also have background reading and questions to consider to help you apply what you learn to your own experience.

And you’ll have the opportunity to put theory into practice – and become more confident about making strategic choices regarding change.

You can start Essentials in Change Management anytime – and study wherever and whenever suits you. It takes around 10 to 12 hours to complete the programme, over a maximum of three months.

title: ESSENTIALS IN SALES SKILLS
description:
The competitive environment you’re facing is intense. Which means knowing how to build relationships with customers, and create seamless customer journeys, is critical for sales success. 

In this 100% online, self-paced programme, you live and learn how to find customers, understand their needs, build strong relationships, add value and adapt for different customer profiles. You also discover how sales can be disrupted by technology – and prepare to take the leap as a confident sales professional.

sections.heading: UNDERSTAND AND SET UP A CUSTOMER-CENTRIC SALES STRATEGY AND EXPLORE SALES TACTICS
sections.content:
ESSENTIALS IN SALES SKILLS
UNDERSTAND AND SET UP A CUSTOMER-CENTRIC SALES STRATEGY AND EXPLORE SALES TACTICS

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Introducing customer-centric selling
sections.content:
This programme comprises 5 modules - each diving into a different aspect of sales management. 

Module 1: Introducing customer-centric selling 
Discover how to create value for your customer, as well as for your own organisation 
Understand the importance of customer-centricity 
Know how to manage customer expectations  
Module 2: Identifying your customers - portfolio analysis
Learn how to focus your efforts on the right customers 
Identify key customers for your company 
Know how to deploy your time and resources effectively by targeting the right customers 
Module 3: Addressing customers' journeys and their corresponding needs  
Understand the importance of customer journeys and use them to identify value-creating opportunities 
Identify pain points in the customer journey 
Discover the importance of working with internal stakeholders to meet the needs of external stakeholders 
Learn how to engage with your customer at every step of their journey 
Module 4: Adapting sales processes to create value   
Discover the importance of a value proposition – and know how to craft one 
Explore customer needs 
Understand your potential customer’s social style, so you can adapt your own 
Identify the questions they may ask – and the responses you should give 
Know how to handle objections and close deals 
Module 5: Selling in the digital age 
Learn how technology shapes the B2B buying and sales process 
Discover the impact of the digitally- empowered customer 
Understand the typical buying process and integrate it with the new hybrid selling process 
Know the role of marketing in the new digital sales process 
Programme design 

Start Essentials in Sales Skills at any time – and study wherever and whenever suits you. It takes around 10 to 12 hours to complete the programme, and you have a maximum of three months to go through all the modules. 

It’s an online journey that’s packed with videos, interviews, exercises, questionnaires and real-life examples. You’ll also have background reading to do – and questions to help you reflect on your own experiences.

sections.heading: Module 1: Understand and develop your strategic direction
sections.content:
The 12-day Excellence in Sales and Marketing programme is a module-based programme based on proven concepts and insights that will turn you in a marketing expert with a strong academic background, capable of taking the right marketing & sales decisions for your company. 

There are four three-day modules – each designed to give you the in-depth knowledge and skills you need to take a firm grasp of marketing & sales.  

You’ll take hands-on lecture sessions, explore life-case studies, and share ideas and experiences with the faculty and your fellow participants. (FYI: Interested in deepening your knowledge even further? Then consider our Executive Master Class in Sales and Marketing). 

Module 1: Understand and develop your strategic direction 
Learn the fundamentals of marketing strategy
Learn to segment, target and position
Discover the 5Cs – company, customers, collaborators, competition and context
Understand value creation and shaping value propositions
Discover scenario thinking to future-proof your strategy
Module 2: Customer Value Management 
Learn to negotiate with purchasers
Master the fundamentals of customer value management
Discover an eight-step roadmap for articulating customer value
Know how to create winning customer value propositions – and sell them
Understand which channels to use to reach your customers – and how to position your offer within them
Module 3: Building brands 
Discover how to build a differentiated brand
Learn to design your B2B brand architecture
Understand the importance of brand equity
Know how to use your brand to communicate sustainability achievements
Dive into pricing and value
Understand B2B customer journeys
Module 4: Sustainable strategies for growth
Develop profitable growth initiatives
Balance customer and shareholder value creation
Discover the seven growth avenues
Dive into sustainable business model innovation
Understand how digital transformation affects sales and customer success
Learn digital marketing and analytics approaches for B2B

Your career ambitions
Why you want to take the programme
Which electives are right for you (if the programme includes electives)

4. Confirm your registration: If you pass the interview, we’ll send you a registration form. You’ll have two weeks to complete and submit the form to confirm your programme place.

sections.heading: Module 1: Understand and develop your strategic direction
sections.content:
Build your knowledge and understanding in two broad phases. In the first, you dive deep into the core areas of sales and marketing. You'll learn to strategise in a way that prioritises digital - and that places sustainability at the core of your activities. 

You'll have a valuable opportunity to apply all of your learning to a strategic project in your own organisation.

And then in the second phase, you deepen your knowledge by choosing electives that best align with the needs of your company and your role. Choose, for example, the Sales Path, to enhance your understanding of Sales Management and Self-Leadership. Or follow the Marketing Path and dive deep into Digital Marketing. If you’d rather build your own path, we’d be happy to help you select your electives. (FYI: If you prefer not to take the electives and the strategic project, take a look at Excellence in Sales and Marketing).

Learn the fundamentals of marketing strategy

Discover the 5Cs – company, customers, collaborators, competition and context
Understand value creation and shaping value propositions
Discover scenario thinking to future-proof your strategy
Module 2: Customer Value Management 
Learn to negotiate with purchasers
Master the fundamentals of customer value management
Discover an eight-step roadmap for articulating customer value
Know how to create winning customer value propositions – and sell them
Understand which channels to use to reach your customers – and how to position your offer within them

Discover how to build a differentiated brand

Dive into pricing and value

Balance customer and shareholder value creation
Discover the seven growth avenues
Dive into sustainable business model innovation

Tackle a strategic sales or marketing challenge in your company – particularly with a sustainability and digital focus
Use your fellow participants and expert faculty as a sounding board
Create value and ROI for your organisation

Tailor your programme to yours and your company’s needs 
Start your electives before, during or after the core modules

title: PRICING
description:
If you’re relying on gut feeling to price your products and services – or you’re using a cost-plus formula, this programme could change your game. 

Prepare to roll up your sleeves and immerse yourself in creating a well-crafted pricing strategy that drives value for your organisation. In your three days on campus, you’ll create – or redefine – a value-based pricing strategy for your company, and you’ll leave with a concrete plan to implement in your business.

sections.heading: CAPTURING MORE VALUE THROUGH BETTER PRICING STRATEGY AND TACTICS
sections.content:
PRICING
CAPTURING MORE VALUE THROUGH BETTER PRICING STRATEGY AND TACTICS

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: The principles of value-based pricing
sections.content:
This programme is organised in partnership with:

Pricing is one of the main drivers of profit in any company – but it’s often one of the least understood. In this 3,5-day programme, you’ll immerse yourself in six modules – each designed to build your knowledge and help you put it into practice immediately.

You’ll live and learn pricing, translating conceptual frameworks into a plan to take back to your own organisation. You’ll gain insights from our expert faculty and business speakers. You’ll dive deep into case studies and cutting-edge approaches. And you’ll learn from your fellow participants too, gaining their perspectives and insights – and understanding the challenges they face in their sectors.

At the end of the programme, you’ll be ready to leap into pricing for your own organisation, with a plan and value-based strategy to price your offer effectively.

The Pricing programme covers six modules: 

Module 1: The principles of value-based pricing
Explore what makes value-based pricing crucial for your company
Discover how to achieve prices that reflect true value
Learn to apply value-based pricing methodology
Module 2: Pricing from a financial perspective
Explore financial implications – and when it makes sense to compete on price
Learn when to discount and premiumise 
Discover how to increase customer lifetime value
Module 3: Making the right pricing decisions
Learn how to turn data into insights
Explore the price sensitivity curve 
Module 4: Pricing from a market perspective
Identify market drivers of price
Discover how to align tactics with market drivers
Examine international differences in pricing 
Module 5: Pricing from sustainability perspective
Determine the willingness to pay for sustainable solutions
Explore how pricing can include the “true” costs – including societal impacts
Discover pricing as a tool to increase the take-up of sustainable solutions
Module 6: Pricing from an organisational perspective
Discover how to structure the pricing process internally
Sounding board: A half-day session to take your business strategy to the next level
Implement what you’ve learned in your own project
Introduce your challenge to Vlerick experts and your peers – and gain valuable feedback
Discover how other professionals and organisations tackle similar questions/challenges in your organisation

A product manager has many roles – from managing existing products and services, positioning and introducing new products and balancing the relationship between sales and R&D. 

On this four-day product management programme, you’ll dive into the key capabilities and skills product champions need, learn how to implement them – and discover how to turn new products into competitive advantage.

sections.heading: Module 1: Creating value as a Product Manager
sections.content:
Product Management is a relatively new discipline. And as part of this first generation of product managers, you face a number of challenges – and opportunities. The Product Management programme is designed to help you navigate them successfully.

Over six modules, you’ll live and learn everything you need to know about product management - from theoretical concepts through to hands-on examples. By the end of the programme, you’ll have the confidence to leap into your role – with a product management toolbox at your fingertips. 

Module 1: Creating value as a Product Manager
Discover the responsibilities and challenges product managers face
Develop a winning value proposition
Explore avenues for growth and managing product lines 
Module 2: Innovating as a vehicle for growth  
Explore ideation as a process for innovation and development
Learn how guidelines can help you select great ideas
Dive into the roadmap to integrate and align innovation planning 
Module 3: Bringing your products to market
Learn to orchestrate a product launch from a communications perspective
Explore strategic pricing and the impact it has on business
Dive into pricing as a product marketing tool 
Module 4: Co-creating with customers
Discover the drivers, benefits and motivators of co-creation
Understand the conditions for success
Explore potential obstacles and limits 
Module 5: Budgeting your product portfolio
Learn to create a financial business plan for new products
Learn to draw up a budget for your product portfolio
Find out how to control your budget
Module 6: Influencing your internal and external stakeholders
Discover how to build trust inside and outside your team
Explore approaches for persuading people
Find out what motivates people to change

DETAILED PROGRAMME

Product Management is a relatively new discipline. And as part of this first generation of product managers, you face a number of challenges – and opportunities. The Product Management programme is designed to help you navigate them successfully.

Over six modules, you’ll live and learn everything you need to know about product management - from theoretical concepts through to hands-on examples. By the end of the programme, you’ll have the confidence to leap into your role – with a product management toolbox at your fingertips. 

Module 1: Creating value as a Product Manager
Discover the responsibilities and challenges product managers face
Develop a winning value proposition
Explore avenues for growth and managing product lines 
Module 2: Innovating as a vehicle for growth  
Explore ideation as a process for innovation and development
Learn how guidelines can help you select great ideas
Dive into the roadmap to integrate and align innovation planning 
Module 3: Bringing your products to market
Learn to orchestrate a product launch from a communications perspective
Explore strategic pricing and the impact it has on business
Dive into pricing as a product marketing tool 
Module 4: Co-creating with customers
Discover the drivers, benefits and motivators of co-creation
Understand the conditions for success
Explore potential obstacles and limits 
Module 5: Budgeting your product portfolio
Learn to create a financial business plan for new products
Learn to draw up a budget for your product portfolio
Find out how to control your budget
Module 6: Influencing your internal and external stakeholders
Discover how to build trust inside and outside your team
Explore approaches for persuading people
Find out what motivates people to change

title: SALES MANAGEMENT
description: As sales manager, you play a critical role in your organisation. Your team helps to drive revenue and maintain a competitive edge – and you need to give them the insights and tools to succeed. On this interactive three-day programme, you’ll live and learn approaches to motivate your team. By the end, you’ll be ready to leap into developing sales strategy and maximising performance.

sections.heading: Module 1: Definers - Sales Management Framework
sections.content:
Over five modules – that are aligned to the drivers of sales force success - you’ll master the skills to lead your sales teams to ever greater heights. This programme combines deep academic insight with Vlerick’s extensive real-world experience. Which gives you a winning combination of skills, insights, tools and understanding.  

Module 1: Definers - Sales Management Framework 
Manage your go-to-market strategy to strengthen your competitive position 
Analyse your customer portfolio and learn to identify and attract the most profitable customers 
Discover approaches to channel management 
Explore trends in sales account management – including how Artificial Intelligence could enhance your team’s performance 
Module 2: Shapers – Shaping your sales team
Identify ways to boost productivity by recruiting and retaining top sales talent 
Discover how to onboard employees and set KPIs
Module 3: Exciters – Compensating your sales team
Identify what really motivates your team
Develop a fair reward strategy for your people
Module 4: Controllers – Evaluating the performance of your sales team
Discover tools to measure and improve your team’s performance 
Get the skills to coach your sales force and lead them in the right direction
Module 5: Simulation game
Make decisions on hiring and firing, who needs coaching and how to set targets in this interactive game

title: OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE
description:
This three-day programme will introduce you to the essentials of operational excellence. You’ll live and learn how to use lean tools and methodologies. And you’ll discover how to manage variability and lead change management. 

After this immersive experience, which includes visiting a company to see all the principles you learn in action, you’ll be able to leap into your organisation with the skills and confidence to create real value.

sections.heading: MAXIMISE CUSTOMER VALUE WHILE REDUCING OPERATIONAL COSTS
sections.content:
OPERATIONAL EXCELLENCE
MAXIMISE CUSTOMER VALUE WHILE REDUCING OPERATIONAL COSTS

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Operational excellence by reducing waste
sections.content:
This three day programme consists of three thought-provoking modules that take you through the key principles of operational excellence. At the end, you have the option to take an exam and gain a recognised certificate in lean methodologies.

Module 1: Operational excellence by reducing waste 
Discover the strategic importance of operational excellence 
Map out the value stream 
Explore lean thinking and the lean toolbox 
Learn about lean maturity 
Put theory into practice on a company visit 
Module 2: Targeting improvement and variability reduction
Dive into operational performance measurement – and link operational and financial KPIs
Discover flow time and capacity analysis
Learn to manage variability and its impact on capacity and service
Understand the impact of quality management
Module 3: Managing the journey towards operational excellence
Discover how to manage the change in your organisation
Explore the actions needed to set up a change project in your organisation
Optional: Lean Competency Accreditation

At the end of the programme, you can choose to take an exam to obtain the Lean Competency certificate from the Lean Enterprise Research Centre of the University of Cardiff. The exam is made up of:

A written exam that assesses your knowledge
An oral defence and discussion with Vlerick professors about an Operational Excellence project you have carried out
To take the exam a supplemental fee of €700 will be charged

title: TRANSFORMING SUPPLY CHAIN MANAGEMENT
description: Many factors could be driving you to rethink your supply chains. Global disruption, shifting trade dynamics, resource scarcity and sustainability all present challenges. But new trends can present opportunities too – particularly data and technology. Join this three-day programme to discover how to leverage technology for supply chain success. You’ll gain cutting-edge insights – and practical tools to build sustainable, successful, future-ready digital supply chains.

sections.heading: Module 1: Trends in supply chain management
sections.content:
This programme empowers you to navigate the complexities of modern supply chain management. You’ll discover how technology is reshaping supply chains. You’ll assess your organisation’s digital maturity – and you’ll develop a compelling business case for change. You’ll dive into sustainability – and create an actionable roadmap to implement in your own organisation.

Module 1: Trends in supply chain management
Understand the impact of trends including globalisation, digitalisation, and sustainability
Assess your organisation's digital maturity – and identify areas for improvement
Discover how data and AI can enhance supply chain efficiency and decision-making
Module 2: Digital transformation
Understand how to build cybersecure, resilient supply chains
Explore technologies including digital twins, blockchain and digital product passports
Learn to compile a business case for digital transformation in the supply chain
Module 3: Sustainable supply chains
Explore key aspects of sustainability, including Scope 1-2-3 emissions, circularity and social impact
Understand the importance of sustainability in modern supply chain management
Learn to integrate sustainability into strategy and operations
Module 4: Action roadmap and application
Discover examples of best practice from industry leaders
Develop an actionable roadmap to implement in your supply chain

sections.heading: Module 1: Introduction to change (online)
sections.content:
Over 3,5 intensive days, you’ll learn approaches, skills and techniques that you can apply directly in your workplace. The learning format blends on campus, online, face-to-face and on-the-job activities. And throughout it all, you’ll have expert guidance from our faculty, who are experts in leading change. 

The programme gives you a unique opportunity to learn new ways of approaching change projects – so that you can have greater impact in your organisation, and enhance your career. 

This programme is offered in a blended format, covering both on-campus and online sessions.

Dive deep into your Change Master Plan

title: ESSENTIALS IN PEOPLE SKILLS
description:
In today’s changeable environment, teamwork is essential for business success. And high-functioning teams need leaders who can include, facilitate and motivate. 

In this 100% online, self-paced programme, you learn to build strong relationships and gain trust and respect. You also discover coaching skills that will allow you to understand your teams, communicate effectively and inspire them to achieve even more.

sections.heading: BECOME AN AUTHENTIC LEADER AND COACH FOR YOUR TEAM

BECOME AN AUTHENTIC LEADER AND COACH FOR YOUR TEAM

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
sections.content: DETAILED PROGRAMME

sections.heading: Module 1: Leadership
sections.content:
This programme comprises 7 modules - each diving into a different aspect of people skills. 

Module 1: Leadership
Recognise the role that people skills play in leadership, particularly authentic leadership  
Define authentic leadership 
Identify how your personality is the gateway to authenticity 
Module 2: Your leadership story
Identify how an individual's life story constitutes a frame for understanding how leadership and authenticity go hand-in-hand 
Relate your own personal story and how it might apply to your leadership and authenticity  
Module 3: Authenticity
Identify the different pathways and methods you can use to develop your authenticity 
Recognise how your mindset plays a crucial role in developing authenticity within yourself and in how you interact with others 
Module 4: Becoming a true coach
Understand the importance of coaching in today's business environment
Familiarise yourself with the golden triangle of coaching
Module 5: Setting goals
Apply goal-setting principles in setting goals for yourself and others
Discover the value of delegation within goal setting
Module 6: Feedback
Apply some basic feedback frameworks in delivering feedback to others
Recognise the value of the 'feedback curve' for planning your intervention
Module 7: Support
Recognise the role of emotions in all aspects of leadership and people skills
Develop basic approaches for managing different types of emotions
Programme design 

This online journey brings together learning formats including videos, interviews, exercises, questionnaires and real-life examples. You’ll also have background reading to do and questions to help you reflect on your own experience.
 
You can start Essentials in People Skills at any time – and study wherever and whenever suits you. It takes around 10 to 12 hours to complete the programme and you can split this time over a maximum of three months. 

Try before you buy

Start for free – no strings attached. This free module gives you a taste of our Essentials programmes. Try it now and explore how Essentials in People Skills helps you lead with confidence, build trust and influence others – all on your own schedule.

title: LEADERSHIP TRANSITION PROGRAMME
description:
Moving into a management role is an exciting time. But without leadership development training, it can be daunting too. That’s why we designed the Leadership Transition Programme.

It blends two high-impact programmes – Self-leadership and The People Manager  – with individual, expert coaching. The result is a powerful 6.5-day learning experience that features high-quality, transformational content at every step. You’ll gain the skills and confidence to step into your management role.

Interested in just one programme? You can also follow Self-leadership and The People Manager as individual programmes.

Moving into a management role is an exciting time. But without leadership development training, it can be daunting too. That’s why we designed the Leadership Transition Programme.

It blends two high-impact programmes – Self-leadership and The People Manager  – with individual, expert coaching. The result is a powerful 6.5-day learning experience that features high-quality, transformational content at every step. You’ll gain the skills and confidence to step into your management role.

Interested in just one programme? You can also follow Self-leadership and The People Manager as individual programmes.

SUCCESS STORIES
ROB JEHOUL

R&D Manager at Vasco Group

The programme gave me a practical method to guide negotiations. Concepts such as BATNA and ZOPA are immediately applicable and have boosted my confidence. The interactive exercises were incredibly insightful. A must for anyone looking to sharpen their negotiation skills

KARIM BOUZIANI

International Strategic Account Manager SD Worx

We negotiate all the time. The programme gave me the theoretical tools to use this insight effectively. What has impacted me most is that, during a negotiation, we can really go for a win-win situation and creatively add value for both parties. This course was particularly interesting because of the practical examples that Prof Tieleman gave and the role playing with professional actors, which allowed us to immediately apply the techniques we had learned.

KATALIEN DENDOOVEN

General Director Wit-Gele Kruis West-Vlaanderen

The importance of good preparation at the start of a negotiation process has been an important learning point. The success of a negotiation is not only about standing up for your own interests, but also about raising the interests of the other party to the surface. When the interests of all parties are clearly revealed, the chance of a successful negotiation is much greater.

CHRIS DERBOVEN

Stedelijk Lyceum Zuid at IKZ-coordinator

This programme changed my approach to negotiation. I’ve learned to do my homework and make sure I understand the interests of all parties before the crucial meeting begins. This allows you to create value for all stakeholders, instead of ending up in a win/lose or even lose/lose situation.

sections.heading: Module 1: Introduction to the world of negotiation
sections.content:
Negotiation Fundamentals is available in a flexible, 100% online format. You immerse yourself in live online webinars and sessions that you can complete at your own pace. 

Through a blend of short videos, reading, reflection, buddy group discussions and real-life negotiation assignments, you’ll live and learn negotiation techniques and theory. 

Spend 2-3 hours per week on the programme and your individual and group assignments to complete it in six weeks. 

You start by gaining deep insight in your own approach. Then you refine it, develop your skills - and put them into practice in hands-on; real-life situations with your fellow participants. This programme is designed and delivered by leading academic and negotiator Katia Tieleman.

Module 1: Introduction to the world of negotiation 
Explore the negotiation playing field  
Discover negotiation styles 
Discover your preferred negotiation style 
Module 2: Introducing the NQ® model 
Discover the four keys 
Dive deep into your NQ® report 
Understand how successful negotiators behave

SUCCESS STORIES
SOPHIE VAN VLIERBERGHE

Resource Manager Business Consulting & Financial Services at Ordina

The Negotiation Fundamentals programme is not merely about tips & tricks for improving your negotiation skills − it really changes your negotiation mind-set, from ‘you win some, you lose some’ to ‘find value creation opportunities for both parties’. You can access this online training programme on a variety of devices, and the fact that it’s online means that you can use it flexibly at your convenience. Vlerick’s approach is academic, but the material is taught so that the learnings are applicable in your daily professional and personal lives. I highly recommend this programme for people and organisations interested in raising their negotiation style to the next level − which is value creation.

Analyse your personal thinking style and explore the styles of others

Maximise your potential by understanding – and playing to – your strengths

Shape your management approach to influence others

Fine-tune your personal action plan

description: Your people can make or break your business – and success depends on how you motivate and lead them. This is why people skills are essential for anyone involved in the management of people. sections.heading: Module 1: The people manager as a recruiter
sections.content:
This programme consists of four modules. Each focuses on a different aspect of managing people – from attracting and motivating teams through to monitoring performance and coaching.

Module 3: The people manager as a communicator and coach
Explore emotions and how to deal with them
Learn the golden rules of effective communication
Become an even better coach
Module 4: The people manager as a motivator and performance manager
Dive into the link between motivation and performance
Learn how to customise performance management 
Discover how to maximise impact

title: ESSENTIALS IN STRATEGY
description:
In today’s highly competitive business environment, organisations need to be able to anticipate and prepare for what’s next. That’s why having the right strategy is fundamental.

Throughout this 100% online, self-paced programme, you discover what a winning strategy looks like. You live and learn frameworks to analyse your organisation’s current strategy – and evaluate projects and actions against it. And you’ll develop the skills to leap into contributing to your organisation’s strategy.

UNDERSTAND KEY STRATEGIC CONCEPTS AND MAKE STRATEGIC CHOICES

sections.heading: DETAILED PROGRAMME
